Sentences_from: A synom Kaatowym, pozostałym z rodzaju tegoż pokolenia, dostało się w połowie pokolenia Manasesowego losem miast dziesięć.
Sentences_to: the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shemer,
Translated_sentences: And the sons of Kaat, others of the kind of this generation, got in the middle of the Manassian generation the fate of the cities ten.

Sentences_from: Cić mówili do Faraona, króla Egipskiego, aby wyprowadzili syny Izraelskie z Egiptu; toć jest ten Mojżesz i Aaron.
Sentences_to: These are those who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring out the children of Israel from Egypt. These are that Moses and Aaron.
Translated_sentences: They said to Pharaoh, King of Egypt, to bring the sons of Israel out of Egypt; this is Moses and Aaron.

Sentences_from: I rzekł: Błogosławiony Pan, Bóg Izraelski, który mówił usty swemi do Dawida, ojca mego, i wypełnił to skutecznie, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: He said, "Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel, who spoke with his mouth to David my father, and has with his hands fulfilled it, saying,
Translated_sentences: And he said, Blessed the Lord, God of Israel, who spoke the mouth of the swemi to David, my father, and fulfilled it effectively, saying:

Sentences_from: Otoś ich wiele uczył, i ręceś mdłe potwierdzał.
Sentences_to: Behold, you have instructed many, you have strengthened the weak hands.
Translated_sentences: Then he taught them a lot, and he confirmed the hands of the bland.

Sentences_from: A tak teraz jeźliście prawdziwie a szczerze uczynili, obrawszy sobie królem Abimelecha; a jeźliście się dobrze obeszli z Jerobaalem i z domem jego, a jeźliście podług dobrodziejstw ręki jego uczynili z nim;
Sentences_to: "Now therefore, if you have dealt truly and righteously, in that you have made Abimelech king, and if you have dealt well with Jerubbaal and his house, and have done to him according to the deserving of his hands
Translated_sentences: And so now you have ridden truly and sincerely done, having ringed yourself the king of Abimelech; and you have ridden well with Jerobaal and his house, and you have ridden the merits of his hand have done with him;

Sentences_from: Przetoż jako płomieó ogniowy pożera parzdzieże, i jako płomieó plewy trawi: tak korzeń ich będzie jako zgnilizna, a kwiat ich jako proch ku górze pójdzie; albowiem odrzucili zakon Pana zastępów, a wyrokiem świętego Izraelskiego pogardzili.
Sentences_to: Therefore as the tongue of fire devours the stubble, and as the dry grass sinks down in the flame, so their root shall be as rottenness, and their blossom shall go up as dust; because they have rejected the law of Yahweh of Armies, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.
Translated_sentences: Hence, as a fire flame, devours the scavenges, and as a flame of the chaff digests: so the root of them will be as rot, and the flower of them as gunpowder towards the top will go; for they have rejected the order of the Lord of the deputies, and by the judgment of the holy Israel despised.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Elijakim, syn Helkijaszowy, i Sobna, i Joach do Rabsacesa: Proszę mów do sług twoich po syryjsku, boć rozumiemy; a nie mów z nami po żydowsku, gdzie słyszy lud, który jest na murze.
Sentences_to: Therefore they spoke to the king of Assyria, saying, "The nations which you have carried away, and placed in the cities of Samaria, don't know the law of the god of the land. Therefore he has sent lions among them, and behold, they kill them, because they don't know the law of the god of the land."
Translated_sentences: Tedy said Elijah, son of Helkiah, and Sobna, and Joach unto Rabsaces, please speak to thy servants in Syrian; we are afraid we understand; and do not speak Jewish with us, where the people who are on the wall hears.

Sentences_from: I wyrzezał na deszczkach po krańcach jego, i po listwowaniach jego Cherubiny, lwy, i palmy, jedno podle drugiego, po każdem przydaniu w około.
Sentences_to: On the plates of its stays, and on its panels, he engraved cherubim, lions, and palm trees, according to the space of each, with wreaths all around.
Translated_sentences: And renounced on the rains at the ends of his, and after the slatings of his Cherubina, lions, and palm trees, one vile of another, after every use in about.

Sentences_from: A czasu, któregośmy chodzili od Kades Barne, ażeśmy się przeprawili przez potok Zared, było trzydzieści i osiem lat, aż wyginął wszystek on naród mężów walecznych z obozu, jako im był przysiągł Pan.
Sentences_to: The days in which we came from Kadesh Barnea, until we had come over the brook Zered, were thirty-eight years; until all the generation of the men of war were consumed from the midst of the camp, as Yahweh swore to them.
Translated_sentences: And the time we walked from the Kades Barne, that we crossed the stream of Zared, was thirty and eight years, until all the men of brave husbands of the camp died out, as they were the Lord swore.

Sentences_from: Nie wywrócisz sądu przychodniowi, ani sierocie, ani weźmiesz w zastawie szaty wdowy;
Sentences_to: There shall be no prostitute of the daughters of Israel, neither shall there be a sodomite of the sons of Israel.
Translated_sentences: You will not return the court to the dispensary, or the orphan, or take the widow's robe in the lien;

Sentences_from: Jam uczynił ziemię, także człowieka i bydlęta, którekolwiek są na obliczu ziemi, mocą swoją wielką i ramieniem swojem wyciągnionem: przeto ja daję temu, który się podoba oczom moim.
Sentences_to: I have made the earth, the men and the animals that are on the surface of the earth, by my great power and by my outstretched arm; and I give it to whom it seems right to me.
Translated_sentences: I have made the earth, also man and cattle, whomever they are on the face of the earth, with his great power and his arm his outstretched: so I give him who pleases to my eyes.

Sentences_from: Pokądże się nie odwrócisz odemnie? a nie zaniechasz mię, ażbym przełknął ślinę moję?
Sentences_to: How long will you not look away from me, nor leave me alone until I swallow down my spittle?
Translated_sentences: Don't you turn around? And you won't abandon me to swallow my saliva?

Sentences_from: Rzekł potem Bóg do Jakóba: Wstań, wstąp do Betela, a mieszkaj tam, i uczyń tam ołtarz Bogu, któryć się ukazał, gdyś uciekał przed obliczem Ezawa, brata twego.
Sentences_to: God said to Jacob, "Arise, go up to Bethel, and live there. Make there an altar to God, who appeared to you when you fled from the face of Esau your brother."
Translated_sentences: Then Allah said unto Jacob, Arise, ascend to Betel, and dwell there, and make there an altar to God, who appeared to have once escaped from the face of Esau, thy brother.

Sentences_from: Tak mówi Pan zastępów: Jeszcze będzie na tem miejscu pustem, na którem niemasz ani człowieka, ani bydlęcia, i we wszystkich miastach jego mieszkanie pasterzy, gdzieby chowali trzody;
Sentences_to: Thus says Yahweh of Armies: Yet again shall there be in this place, which is waste, without man and without animal, and in all its cities, a habitation of shepherds causing their flocks to lie down.
Translated_sentences: So says the Lord of the deputies: He will still be empty in this place, for which you have neither man nor cattle, and in all the cities his shepherds dwelling where they hide the pigs;

Sentences_from: Tedy zawołał Salomona, syna swego, a przykazał mu, aby zbudował dom Panu, Bogu Izraelskiemu.
Sentences_to: Then he called for Solomon his son, and commanded him to build a house for Yahweh, the God of Israel.
Translated_sentences: Tedy called Solomon, his son, and commanded him to build a house to the Lord, God of Israel.

Sentences_from: Słuchajże tego pilnie, Ijobie! zastanów się, a uważaj dziwne sprawy Boże.
Sentences_to: "Listen to this, Job. Stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.
Translated_sentences: I'm listening to this urgently, Ijobie! think about it, and beware the strange things of God.

Sentences_from: Wodyś spracowanemu nie podał, a głodnemu odmówiłeś chleba.
Sentences_to: You haven't given water to the weary to drink, and you have withheld bread from the hungry.
Translated_sentences: You didn't give it to the hungry, and you said no bread to the hungry man.

Sentences_from: Tamar zasię, niewiastka jego, urodziła mu Faresa i Zarę. Wszystkich synów Judowych pięć.
Sentences_to: Tamar his daughter-in-law bore him Perez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were five.
Translated_sentences: Tamar is a woman of his, bore him Fares and Zara. All the sons of Judah five.

Sentences_from: Jednak Farao obciążył serce swe i tym razem, a nie wypuścił ludu.
Sentences_to: Pharaoh said, "I will let you go, that you may sacrifice to Yahweh your God in the wilderness, only you shall not go very far away. Pray for me."
Translated_sentences: However, Farao put a strain on his heart and this time, and he did not let the people out.

Sentences_from: A inne sprawy Manachemowe, i cokolwiek czynił, napisane są w kronikach o królach Izraelskich.
Sentences_to: All the people of Judah took Azariah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in the place of his father Amaziah.
Translated_sentences: And the other Manachem affairs, and whatever he did, are written in the chronicles about the kings of Israel.

Sentences_from: Wywyższy się ręka twoja nad nieprzyjaciołmi twoimi, a wszyscy przeciwnicy twoi wykorzenieni będą.
Sentences_to: The remnant of Jacob will be among the nations, in the midst of many peoples, like a lion among the animals of the forest, like a young lion among the flocks of sheep; who, if he goes through, treads down and tears in pieces, and there is no one to deliver.
Translated_sentences: Your hand will rise above your enemies, and all your adversaries will be eradicated.

Sentences_from: Ale Barak gonił wozy i wojsko aż do Haroset pogańskiego; i poległo wszystko wojsko Sysarowe od ostrza miecza, tak iż z nich i jeden nie został.
Sentences_to: But Barak pursued after the chariots, and after the army, to Harosheth of the Gentiles: and all the army of Sisera fell by the edge of the sword; there was not a man left.
Translated_sentences: But Barak chased the wagons and the army all the way to the Heathen Haroset; and all the Sysar army fell from the blade of the sword, so that of them and one did not stay.

Sentences_from: To mi ukazał panujący Pan. Oto tworzył szaraóczę, gdy najpierwej począł odrastać potraw, gdy oto potraw był po pokoszeniu królewskiem.
Sentences_to: Thus the Lord Yahweh showed me: and behold, he formed locusts in the beginning of the shooting up of the latter growth; and behold, it was the latter growth after the king's harvest.
Translated_sentences: That's what the reigning Lord showed me. Behold, he created greysae, when the most early food began to grow back, when, behold, the dishes were after the love of the royal.

Sentences_from: Abym ci do wiadomości podał pewność powieści prawdziwych, abyś umiał odnosić słowa prawdy tym, którzy cię posłali.
Sentences_to: To teach you truth, reliable words, to give sound answers to the ones who sent you?
Translated_sentences: So that you know, he gave you the confidence of true novels, so that you can relate the words of truth to those who sent you.

Sentences_from: Któremu odpowiedział pan jego: Nie wstępujmy do miasta cudzoziemców, które nie jest z synów Izraelskich, ale idźmy aż do Gabaa.
Sentences_to: His master said to him, "We won't turn aside into the city of a foreigner, that is not of the children of Israel; but we will pass over to Gibeah."
Translated_sentences: To whom you replied his: Let us not enter into the city of foreigners, which is not of the sons of Israel, but let us go all the way to Gabaa.

Sentences_from: Synów z Karyjatyjarymu, z Kafiry i z Beerotu siedm set i czterdzieści i trzy;
Sentences_to: The children of Kiriath Arim, Chephirah, and Beeroth, seven hundred forty-three.
Translated_sentences: Sons of Karyatyarm, from Kafira and from Beerot seven hundred and forty and three;

Sentences_from: Izali nie ty, o Boże! któryś nas był odrzucił, a nie wychodziłeś, o Boże! z wojskami naszemi?
Sentences_to: Give us help against the enemy, for the help of man is vain.
Translated_sentences: Izali not you, oh God! One was rejecting us, and you weren't leaving, oh god! with our troops?

Sentences_from: I były miasta w granicach pokolenia synów Judowych podle granicy Edom ku południowi: Kabseel, i Eder, i Jagur.
Sentences_to: The farthest cities of the tribe of the children of Judah toward the border of Edom in the South were Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur,
Translated_sentences: And there were cities within a generation of sons of Judah vile the border of Edom towards the south: Kabseel, and Eder, and Jagur.

Sentences_from: I położyli zbroję jego w kościele Astarot; ale ciało jego przybili na murze Betsan.
Sentences_to: They put his armor in the house of the Ashtaroth; and they fastened his body to the wall of Beth Shan.
Translated_sentences: And they laid his armour in the church of Astarot; but his body was nailed on the wall of Betsan.

Sentences_from: I uczynili rotmistrze oni według wszystkiego, co im był rozkazał Jojada kapłan; a wziąwszy każdy męże swe, którzy przychodzili w sabat, i którzy odchodzili w sabat, przyszli do Jojady kapłana.
Sentences_to: The captains over hundreds did according to all that Jehoiada the priest commanded; and they took every man his men, those who were to come in on the Sabbath, with those who were to go out on the Sabbath, and came to Jehoiada the priest.
Translated_sentences: And they did to the rotmaster, according to all that was commanded by Joyad the priest; and, having taken all their men who came on the coven, and who departed on the coven, came to Joyada the priest.

Sentences_from: Czego dostać mógł, jedno z tych będzie ofiarą za grzech, a drugie na ofiarę całopalenia z ofiarą śniedną; a tak oczyści kapłan tego, który się oczyszcza przed obliczem Pańskiem.
Sentences_to: If the priest examines the plague of itching, and behold, its appearance isn't deeper than the skin, and there is no black hair in it, then the priest shall isolate him the person infected with itching seven days.
Translated_sentences: What he could get, one of these will be a sacrifice for sin, and the other for the offering of burns with the sacrifice of the snow; and so will purify the priest of the one who clears himself before the face of the Lord.

Sentences_from: Ale nie chciał: i rzekł do żony pana swego: Oto, pan mój nie wie, tak jako ja, co jest w domu jego; bo wszystko, co miał, podał w ręce moje.
Sentences_to: But he refused, and said to his master's wife, "Behold, my master doesn't know what is with me in the house, and he has put all that he has into my hand.
Translated_sentences: But he did not want to: and said unto his lord's wife, Behold, my Lord does not know, so as I, what is in his house; for all he had, he put mine into his hands.

Sentences_from: Tak bowiem Pan rzekł do mnie, ująwszy mię za rękę, i dał mi przestrogę, żebym nie chodził drogą ludu tego, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: For Yahweh spoke thus to me with a strong hand, and instructed me not to walk in the way of this people, saying,
Translated_sentences: For so the Lord said unto me, having taken my hand, and gave me a cautionary note that I would not walk the way of the people of this, saying:

Sentences_from: A Heberowi urodzili się dwa synowie: imię jednemu Faleg, iż za dni jego rozdzielona jest ziemia; a imię brata jego Jektan.
Sentences_to: To Eber were born two sons. The name of the one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided. His brother's name was Joktan.
Translated_sentences: And Heber was born two sons: the name of one Faleg, that in days his land is separated; and the name of his brother Jektan.

Sentences_from: Omyjcie się, czystymi bądźcie, odejmijcie złość uczynków waszych od oczów moich; przestaócie źle czynić.
Sentences_to: Wash yourselves, make yourself clean. Put away the evil of your doings from before my eyes. Cease to do evil.
Translated_sentences: Wipe yourselves, pure be, subtract the spite of your deeds from my eyes; you will cease to do wrong.

Sentences_from: Przyłożę i ręce moje do rozkazaó twoich, które miłuję, a będę rozmyślał o ustawach twoich.
Sentences_to: I reach out my hands for your commandments, which I love. I will meditate on your statutes.
Translated_sentences: I will hold my hands to your orders, which I love, and I will think about your laws.

Sentences_from: Psalm Dawidowy. Pan jest światłością moją, i zbawieniem mojem, kogóż się bać będę? Pan jest mocą żywota mego, kogóż się mam lękać?
Sentences_to: < < By David. > > Yahweh is my light and my salvation. Whom shall I fear? Yahweh is the strength of my life. Of whom shall I be afraid?
Translated_sentences: Psalm of David. The Lord is my light, and my salvation, who am I afraid of? The Lord are the power of my life, who am I to fear?

Sentences_from: Przetoż ty idź, a czytaj na tych księgach, coś napisał z ust moich, słowa Pańskie, przed uszyma ludu w domu Pańskim w dzień postu; także też przed uszyma wszystkich z Judy którzyby przyszli z miast swoich, czytaj je.
Sentences_to: therefore you go, and read in the scroll, which you have written from my mouth, the words of Yahweh in the ears of the people in Yahweh's house on the fast day; and also you shall read them in the ears of all Judah who come out of their cities.
Translated_sentences: For thou go, and read on these books, something wrote from my mouth, the words of the Lord, before the sewing of the people in the house of the LORD on the day of fasting; also before the sewing of all of Judah who came from their cities, read them.

Sentences_from: Ale szczodrze otworzysz mu rękę twoję, i ochotnie pożyczysz mu, ile będzie potrzebował i czego by mu niedostawało.
Sentences_to: The pig, because it has a split hoof but doesn't chew the cud, is unclean to you: of their flesh you shall not eat, and their carcasses you shall not touch.
Translated_sentences: But you will open your hand to him, and you will willingly lend him how much he needs and what he doesn't get.

Sentences_from: I znalazłeś serce jego wierne przed obliczem twojem, i uczyniłeś z nim przymierze, że dasz ziemię Chananejczyka, Hetejczyka, Amorejczyka, i Ferezejczyka, i Jebuzejczyka, i Giergiezejczyka, że ją dasz nasieniu jego, i ziściłeś słowa twoje; boś ty sprawiedliwy.
Sentences_to: and found his heart faithful before you, and made a covenant with him to give the land of the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Amorite, and the Perizzite, and the Jebusite, and the Girgashite, to give it to his seed, and have performed your words; for you are righteous.
Translated_sentences: And you found his heart faithful before your face, and you made a covenant with him, that you will give the land of the Chananite, the Hetean, the Amorean, and the Ferezian, and the Jebuzensan, and the Giergensan, that you will give it to his semen, and thy words; God thou righteous.

Sentences_from: Izali się zawstydzili, przeto, że obrzydliwość czynili? Zaiste, ani się zapałać ani wstydzić umieli; przetoż upadną między padającymi, czasu nawiedzenia swego upadną, mówi Pan.
Sentences_to: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore shall they fall among those who fall; in the time of their visitation they shall be cast down, says Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: Izala embarrassed themselves, so that they did abomination? Indeed, neither to catch fire nor shame the dead; they will fall between the rains, the time of their haunt will fall, says the LORD.

Sentences_from: A gdy nań nalegali aż do uprzykrzenia, rzekł: Poślijcież. A tak posłali onych pięćdziesiąt mężów, którzy szukając przez trzy dni nie znaleźli go.
Sentences_to: When they urged him until he was ashamed, he said, "Send them." They sent therefore fifty men; and they searched for three days, but didn't find him.
Translated_sentences: And when the nuns insisted until the snub, he said, Slip. And so they sent them fifty husbands, who, searching for three days, did not find him.

Sentences_from: Rozkazał też ludowi mieszkającemu w Jeruzalemie, aby oddawali dział kapłanom i Lewitom, aby byli tem pilniejszymi w zakonie Pańskim.
Sentences_to: The thing was right in the eyes of the king and of all the assembly.
Translated_sentences: He also ordered the people living in Jerusalem to give the department to priests and Levites to be more urgent in the Order of the Lord.

Sentences_from: Ale gdyby Bóg chciał mówić, i otworzyć usta swoje przeciwko tobie:
Sentences_to: But oh that God would speak, and open his lips against you,
Translated_sentences: But if God wanted to speak, and open his mouth against you:

Sentences_from: Tedy podniósłszy Lot oczy swe, obaczył wszystkę równinę nad Jordanem, iż wszystka wilgotna była przedtem, niż zatracił Pan Sodomę i Gomorrę, jako sąd Pański, i jako ziemia Egipska, idąc do Zoar.
Sentences_to: Lot lifted up his eyes, and saw all the plain of the Jordan, that it was well-watered everywhere, before Yahweh destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, like the garden of Yahweh, like the land of Egypt, as you go to Zoar.
Translated_sentences: Tedy has raised his eyes; he has wowed all the plain above the Jordan that all damp was before than the Lord of Sodom and Gomorra, as the court of the Lord, and as the land of Egypt, going to Zoar.

Sentences_from: Także i o Syonie mówić będą:Ten i ów urodził się w nim; a sam Najwyższy ugruntuje go.
Sentences_to: Yes, of Zion it will be said, "This one and that one was born in her"; the Most High himself will establish her.
Translated_sentences: It is also Syon to speak of this:He and he was born in him; and the Supreme himself will establish him.

Sentences_from: I Hasabijasza, a z nim Jesajasza z synów Merarego, braci jego, i synów ich dwadzieścia;
Sentences_to: and Hashabiah, and with him Jeshaiah of the sons of Merari, his brothers and their sons, twenty;
Translated_sentences: And Hasabijah, and with him Jesaiah of Merary's sons, his brothers, and their sons twenty;

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Pan do Izajasza: Wyjdź teraz przeciw Achazowi, ty, i Sear Jasub, syn twój, na koniec rur sadzawki wyższej, na drogę pola farbierzowego;
Sentences_to: Then Yahweh said to Isaiah, "Go out now to meet Ahaz, you, and Shearjashub your son, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool, on the highway of the fuller's field.
Translated_sentences: Tedy said the LORD unto Isaiah, Exit now against Ahaz, you, and Sear Jasub, thy son, at the end of the pipes of the upper seed, into the way of the paint field;

Sentences_from: (Bo tam sześć miesięcy mieszkał Joab ze wszystkimi Izraelczykami, aż wytracił wszystkie mężczyzny w Edom.)
Sentences_to: (for Joab and all Israel remained there six months, until he had cut off every male in Edom);
Translated_sentences: (Because that's where the six months Joab lived with all the Israelis until he lost all the man in Edom.)

Sentences_from: Lecz ty królu, panie mój, wiesz, iż się oczy wszystkiego Izraela oglądają na cię, abyś im oznajmił, kto będzie siedział na stolicy króla, pana mego, po tobie.
Sentences_to: You, my lord the king, the eyes of all Israel are on you, that you should tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.
Translated_sentences: But you king, my lord, you know that the eyes of all Israel are watching upon you to tell them who will be sitting on the capital of the king, my lord, after you.

Sentences_from: I gdy się uszykowali Filistynowie przeciwko Izraelowi, a stoczyła się bitwa: tedy porażony jest Izrael od Filistynów, a pobito ich w onej bitwie na polu około czterech tysięcy mężów.
Sentences_to: The Philistines put themselves in array against Israel: and when they joined battle, Israel was struck before the Philistines; and they killed of the army in the field about four thousand men.
Translated_sentences: And when the Philistines were seated against Israel, and a battle was fought: then Israel is infested from the Philistines, and they were beaten in this battle in the field of about four thousand husbands.

Sentences_from: I pobili Moabitów na ten czas około dziesięciu tysięcy mężów, wszystko bogatych, i wszystko mężów dużych, a nikt nie uszedł.
Sentences_to: They struck of Moab at that time about ten thousand men, every lusty man, and every man of valor; and there escaped not a man.
Translated_sentences: And they beat up the Moabites for that time about ten thousand husbands, all rich, and all husbands large, and no one went.

Sentences_from: Biada! bo wielki jest ten dzień, tak, że mu nie było podobnego; ale jakiżkolwiek jest czas utrapienia Jakóbowego, przecie z niego wybawiony będzie.
Sentences_to: Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of Jacob's trouble; but he shall be saved out of it.
Translated_sentences: Woe! for the day is great, so that it was not like it; but however the time of the affliction of Yakób is, it will be delivered from it.

Sentences_from: Zmacniajcież się, a bądźcie mężami, o Filistynowie! byście snać nie służyli Hebrejczykom, jako oni wam służyli. Bądźcież tedy mężami, a potykajcie się.
Sentences_to: Be strong, and behave like men, O you Philistines, that you not be servants to the Hebrews, as they have been to you. Strengthen yourselves like men, and fight!"
Translated_sentences: Step up, and be husbands, O Philistines! that you must not serve the Hebreians as they serve you. Be your husbands then, and stumble.

Sentences_from: I rzekli do niego: Oto teraz jest przy sługach twych pięćdziesiąt mężów mocnych. Proszę niech idą, a niech szukają Pana twego; by go snać nie zaniósł Duch Pański, a nie porzucił go na której górze, albo w której dolinie. Ale im on rzekł: Nie posyłajcie.
Sentences_to: They said to him, "See now, there are with your servants fifty strong men. Please let them go and seek your master. Perhaps the Spirit of Yahweh has taken him up, and put him on some mountain, or into some valley. He said, "You shall not send them."
Translated_sentences: And they said unto him, Behold now is with the servants of your fifty strongmen. Let them go, and may they seek thy Lord; that the Spirit of the LORD shall not be carried by the Spirit of the LORD, and not abandon him on which mountain, or in which valley. But he said to them, “Do not send.

Sentences_from: Lew ginie, iż nie ma łupu, i szczenięta lwie rozproszone bywają.
Sentences_to: The old lion perishes for lack of prey. The cubs of the lioness are scattered abroad.
Translated_sentences: The lion dies that there is no booty, and the lion puppies are scattered.

Sentences_from: Ale kapłani stali w rzędach swych: Lewitowie także z instrumentami muzyki Pańskiej, które był sprawił Dawid król ku chwaleniu Pana, (że na wieki miłosierdzie jego) pieśnią Dawidową, którą im podał. Inni też kapłani trąbili przeciwko nim, a wszyscy Izraelczycy stali.
Sentences_to: The priests stood, according to their positions; the Levites also with instruments of music of Yahweh, which David the king had made to give thanks to Yahweh, when David praised by their ministry, saying "For his loving kindness endures for ever." The priests sounded trumpets before them; and all Israel stood.
Translated_sentences: But the priests stood in rows of their own: the Levites also with instruments of the Lord's music, which was made by David the King in praise of the Lord, (that for ever mercy of his) with the song of David which he gave them. Others, too, priests trumpeted against them, and all Israelis stood.

Sentences_from: Dla zimna leniwy nie orze; przetoż żebrać będzie we żniwa, ale nic nie otrzyma.
Sentences_to: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the winter; therefore he shall beg in harvest, and have nothing.
Translated_sentences: For the cold lazy do not orse; therefore, begging will be in the harvest, but will receive nothing.

Sentences_from: Nie będę się zaiste na wieki wadził, ani się wiecznie gniewał; boćby duch przed obliczem mojem zemdlał, i dusze, którem Ja uczynił.
Sentences_to: For I will not contend forever, neither will I be always angry; for the spirit would faint before me, and the souls who I have made.
Translated_sentences: I shall not waver for ever, nor am I ever angry; the spirit before my face fainted, and the souls which I have done.

Sentences_from: Nieprzyjaciele moi mówili źle o mnie: Kiedyż wżdy umrze, a zginie imię jego?
Sentences_to: If he comes to see me, he speaks falsehood. His heart gathers iniquity to itself. When he goes abroad, he tells it.
Translated_sentences: My enemies said ill of me: Whenever will he die, and his name will die?

Sentences_from: Ale nie mogli synowi Manasesowi wypędzić z onych miast obywateli; przetoż począł Chananejczyk mieszkać w onej ziemi.
Sentences_to: Yet the children of Manasseh couldn't drive out the inhabitants of those cities; but the Canaanites would dwell in that land.
Translated_sentences: But the son of Manases could not drive citizens from these cities; the Khananite had come to live in this land.

Sentences_from: Nie przystoi głupiemu rozkosz, ani słudze panować nad książętami.
Sentences_to: Delicate living is not appropriate for a fool, much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
Translated_sentences: He will not befit a foolish delight, or a servant to reign over the princes.

Sentences_from: A Joab wróciwszy się z pogoni za Abnerem, zebrał wszystek lud, i nie dostawało mu sług Dawidowych dziewiętnastu mężów, i Asaela.
Sentences_to: Joab returned from following Abner: and when he had gathered all the people together, there lacked of David's servants nineteen men and Asahel.
Translated_sentences: And Joab, having returned from the pursuit of Abner, had gathered all the people, and had no servants of David's nineteen husbands, and Asael.

Sentences_from: Poruszę, mówię, wszystkie narody, i przyjdą do Pożądanego od wszystkich narodów; i napełnię ten dom chwałą, mówi Pan zastępów.
Sentences_to: and I will shake all nations. The precious things of all nations will come, and I will fill this house with glory, says Yahweh of Armies.
Translated_sentences: I shall move, I say, all nations, and come to the Desired of all nations; and I shall fill this house with glory, says the Lord of the deputies.

Sentences_from: A przysionki zewsząd w około na dwadzieścia i pięć łokci wdłuż, a wszerz na pięćdziesiąt łokci.
Sentences_to: There were arches all around, twenty-five cubits long, and five cubits broad.
Translated_sentences: And the squeaks from everywhere in about twenty and five cubits, and the breadth is fifty cubits.

Sentences_from: Tylko ziemi kapłańskiej nie kupił; bo kapłani mieli obrok postanowiony od Faraona, i żywili się obrokiem swym, który im dał Farao; dlategoż nie sprzedawali ziemi swej.
Sentences_to: Only he didn't buy the land of the priests, for the priests had a portion from Pharaoh, and ate their portion which Pharaoh gave them. That is why they didn't sell their land.
Translated_sentences: Only the priestly land did not buy; for the priests had an obedient decided from Pharaoh, and they fed on their pivot which Farao gave them; they did not sell their land.

Sentences_from: Roku pierwszego Cyrusa, króla Perskiego, aby się wypełniło słowo Pańskie powiedziane przez usta Jeremijaszowe, wzbudził Pan ducha Cyrusa, króla Perskiego, że kazał obwołać i rozpisać po wszystkiem królestwie swojem, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of Yahweh by the mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished, Yahweh stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, so that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying,
Translated_sentences: The year of the first Cyrus, king of Persian, to fulfill the word of the Lord said by the mouth of Jeremiah, aroused the Lord of the spirit of Cyrus, king of the Persian, that he had to call and dispense all the kingdom by his own, saying:

Sentences_from: Gdy im będziesz mówił te wszystkie słowa, i ciebie nie usłuchają; a gdy na nich wołać będziesz, nie ozwąć się.
Sentences_to: You shall speak all these words to them; but they will not listen to you: you shall also call to them; but they will not answer you.
Translated_sentences: When you speak all these words to them, and they will not listen to you; and when you call upon them, do not call yourself.

Sentences_from: Przetoż tak mówi panujący Pan: Biada temu miastu krwawemu, garncowi, w którym zostaje przywara jego, z którego, mówię, przywara jego nie wychodzi: po sztukach, po sztukach wyciągaj z niego, nie padnieć nań los.
Sentences_to: Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh: Woe to the bloody city, to the caldron whose rust is therein, and whose rust is not gone out of it! take out of it piece after piece; No lot is fallen on it.
Translated_sentences: So says the reigning Lord: Woe to this bloody city, to the pot in which he is given, from which, I say, he does not come out: after the plays, pull out of it, do not fall fate.

Sentences_from: Owszem, byłem szczerym przed nim, a strzegłem się od nieprawości mojej.
Sentences_to: Therefore Yahweh has rewarded me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his eyesight.
Translated_sentences: Yes, I was honest in front of him, and I guarded myself from my iniquity.

Sentences_from: Z synów Sechanijaszowych, który był z synów Faresowych, Zacharyjasz, a z nim poczet mężów sto i pięćdziesiąt;
Sentences_to: Of the sons of Shecaniah, of the sons of Parosh, Zechariah; and with him were reckoned by genealogy of the males one hundred fifty.
Translated_sentences: Of the sons of Sechanyah, who was of the sons of the Phares, Zacharyjah, and with him the husband of one hundred and fifty;

Sentences_from: Dwadzieścia i dwa lata miał Amon, gdy królować począł, a dwa lata królował w Jeruzalemie. A imię matki jego było Masallemet, córka Harusa z Jateby.
Sentences_to: Then Hezekiah said to Isaiah, "The word of Yahweh which you have spoken is good." He said moreover, "Isn't it so, if peace and truth shall be in my days?"
Translated_sentences: Twenty and two years old had Amon when the reign conceded, and two years reigned in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Masallemet, daughter of Harus of Jateba.

Sentences_from: Efa też, założnica Kalebowa, urodziła Harana, i Moze, i Giezeza; a Haran spłodził Giezeza.
Sentences_to: Ephah, Caleb's concubine, bore Haran, and Moza, and Gazez; and Haran became the father of Gazez.
Translated_sentences: Efa too, Kalebiv's founding, gave birth to Haran, and Moze, and Giezez; and Haran begat Giezez.

Sentences_from: Wstała tedy Anna, gdy się najedli i napili w Sylo; a Heli kapłan siedział na stołku u podwoja kościoła Pańskiego.
Sentences_to: So Hannah rose up after they had eaten in Shiloh, and after they had drunk. Now Eli the priest was sitting on his seat by the doorpost of Yahweh's temple.
Translated_sentences: Then Anna rose when they raided and drank in Sylo; and Heli the priest sat on a stool at the double of the Church of the Lord.

Sentences_from: I oddali wyroki królewskie starostom królewskim, i książętom za rzeką, a ci byli pomocą ludowi i domowi Bożemu.
Sentences_to: They delivered the king's commissions to the king's satraps, and to the governors beyond the River: and they furthered the people and God's house.
Translated_sentences: And they gave the royal sentences to the royal starosts, and the princes behind the river, and those helped the people and the house of God.

Sentences_from: Obliczcie sumę wszystkiego zgromadzenia synów Izraelskich według narodów ich, i według domów ojców ich według imion ich, każdego mężczyznę według głów ich.
Sentences_to: "Take a census of all the congregation of the children of Israel, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of the names, every male, one by one;
Translated_sentences: Calculate the sum of all congregation of the sons of Israel according to their peoples, and according to the houses of their fathers by their names, each man according to the heads of theirs.

Sentences_from: Chorągiew obozu Danowego położy się ku północy według hufców swych, a hetmanem nad syny Danowymi Achiezer, syn Ammisadajów;
Sentences_to: "On the north side shall be the standard of the camp of Dan according to their divisions: and the prince of the children of Dan shall be Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
Translated_sentences: Danów's camp will lie towards the north according to his hufks, and hetman over his son Danów Achiezer, son of the Ammisadai;

Sentences_from: Pomaże też kapłan oną oliwą, która jest na dłoni jego, koniec ucha prawego temu, który się oczyszcza; także wielki palec prawej ręki jego, i wielki palec prawej nogi jego na miejscu krwi z ofiary za występek;
Sentences_to: If the bright spot stays in its place, and hasn't spread in the skin, but is faded, it is the swelling from the burn, and the priest shall pronounce him clean; for it is the scar from the burn.
Translated_sentences: It will also be helped by the priest with olive, which is on his hand, the end of the ear of the right one that clears; also the great finger of his right hand, and the great finger of his right leg in place of blood from the victim for the vice;

Sentences_from: A do Neftalima rzekł: Neftali, nasycony przyjaźni i pełny błogosławieństwa Pańskiego, zachód i południe opanujesz.
Sentences_to: He commissioned Joshua the son of Nun, and said, "Be strong and courageous; for you shall bring the children of Israel into the land which I swore to them: and I will be with you."
Translated_sentences: And to Nephthalim said, Neftali, saturated with friendship and full of the blessing of the Lord, west and south you will master.

Sentences_from: Przywróć mi radość zbawienia twego, a duchem dobrowolnym podeprzyj mię.
Sentences_to: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, the God of my salvation. My tongue shall sing aloud of your righteousness.
Translated_sentences: Restore me the joy of thy salvation, and in a willful spirit beg me.

Sentences_from: Chwalcie imię jego na piszczałkach; na bębnie i na harfie grajcie mu.
Sentences_to: Let them praise his name in the dance! Let them sing praises to him with tambourine and harp!
Translated_sentences: Praise his name on his squeals; on the drum and on the harp, play him.

Sentences_from: Tedyś rzekł do sług swoich: Jeźli nie przyjdzie brat wasz młodszy z wami, nie ujrzycie więcej oblicza mojego.
Sentences_to: You said to your servants, 'Unless your youngest brother comes down with you, you will see my face no more.'
Translated_sentences: Theses said unto his servants, If your younger brother does not come with you, ye shall see no more face of mine.

Sentences_from: Potknie się zaiste hardy, i upadnie, a nie będzie, ktoby go podniósł; i rozniecę ogieó w miastach jego, który pożre wszystko około niego.
Sentences_to: The proud one shall stumble and fall, and none shall raise him up; and I will kindle a fire in his cities, and it shall devour all who are around him.
Translated_sentences: He will stumble upon the heighty hardy, and he will fall, and he will not raise him; and I will displace the colt in his cities, which will devour everything around him.

Sentences_from: Ale Żydzi, którzy byli w Susan, zebrali się dnia trzynastego i czternastego tegoż miesiąca; a odpoczęli piętnastego dnia tegoż miesiąca, i sprawowali dnia onego uczty i wesela.
Sentences_to: But the Jews who were in Shushan assembled together on the thirteenth and on the fourteenth days of the month; and on the fifteenth day of that month, they rested, and made it a day of feasting and gladness.
Translated_sentences: But the Jews who were in Susan gathered on the thirteenth and fourteenth of that month; and they rested on the fifteenth day of that month, and held the day of the feast and wedding.

Sentences_from: Między gładkim kamieniem potokowym jest dział twój. Cić są, ci losem twoim, na które też wylewasz ofiarę mokrą, a ofiarujesz ofiarę śniedną, i w temże bym się Ja kochał?
Sentences_to: Among the smooth stones of the valley is your portion; they, they are your lot; you have even poured a drink offering to them. You have offered an offering. Shall I be appeased for these things?
Translated_sentences: Between the smooth brook stone is your department. Thou shalt be, thy fate, upon which you also pour the prey wet, and offer the sacrifice the snow, and thou shalt make love?

Sentences_from: Strzeżcież się, byście snać nie zapomnieli przymierza Pana, Boga waszego, które uczynił z wami, a nie czynili sobie rytego obrazu na kształt jakiejkolwiek rzeczy, jakoć rozkazał Pan, Bóg twój.
Sentences_to: Take heed to yourselves, lest you forget the covenant of Yahweh your God, which he made with you, and make you an engraved image in the form of anything which Yahweh your God has forbidden you.
Translated_sentences: Beware that you must not forget the covenant of the Lord, your God, which he has done with you, and do not make yourself an engraved image into the shape of any thing as the Lord, thy God commanded.

Sentences_from: Ziemia Ataret i Dybon, i Jazer, i Nemra, i Hesebon, i Eleale, i Seban, i Nebo, i Beon:
Sentences_to: Moses spoke to the people, saying, "Arm men from among you for the war, that they may go against Midian, to execute Yahweh's vengeance on Midian.
Translated_sentences: Land Ataret and Dybon, and Jazer, and Nemra, and Hesebon, and Eleale, and Seban, and Nebo, and Beon:

Sentences_from: Boś mi bywał na pomocy; przetoż w cieniu skrzydeł twoich śpiewać będę.
Sentences_to: My soul stays close to you. Your right hand holds me up.
Translated_sentences: God was at my aid; so in the shadow of your wings I shall sing.

Sentences_from: Cić są synowie Semowi w domach swych, w językach swych, w ziemiach swych, w narodziech swych.
Sentences_to: These are the sons of Shem, after their families, after their languages, in their lands, after their nations.
Translated_sentences: They are the sons of Sm in their houses, in their tongues, in their lands, in their own people.

Sentences_from: Znalazłem Dawida, sługę mego; olejkiem świętym moim pomazałem go.
Sentences_to: with whom my hand shall be established. My arm will also strengthen him.
Translated_sentences: I found David, my servant; with my holy oil I anointed him.

Sentences_from: Serce królewskie jest w ręce Pańskiej jako potoki wód; kędy chce, nakłoni je.
Sentences_to: The king's heart is in Yahweh's hand like the watercourses. He turns it wherever he desires.
Translated_sentences: The royal heart is in the Lord's hand as a torrent of waters; the hens wants, he will prick them.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Bóg do Abrahama: Niech to przykro nie będzie w oczach twoich z strony dziecięcia, i z strony służebnicy twojej; coćkolwiek rzecze Sara, usłuchaj głosu jej; boć w Izaaku nazwane będzie nasienie.
Sentences_to: God said to Abraham, "Don't let it be grievous in your sight because of the boy, and because of your handmaid. In all that Sarah says to you, listen to her voice. For from Isaac will your seed be called.
Translated_sentences: Thedy said Allah unto Abraham, Let it be sorry not in your eyes of the baby, and of thy handmaid; whatsoever things Sara, listen to her voice; the fear in Isaac shall be named the seed.

Sentences_from: Tyś chodzenie moje i leżenie moje ogarnął, świadomeś wszystkich dróg moich.
Sentences_to: You search out my path and my lying down, and are acquainted with all my ways.
Translated_sentences: Thou walking mine and lying mine have embraced, you are aware of all my ways.

Sentences_from: A góra Synaj kurzyła się wszystka, przeto, iż zstąpił na nią Pan w ogniu; i występował dym z niej, jako dym z pieca, i trzęsła się wszystka góra bardzo.
Sentences_to: Mount Sinai, all it, smoked, because Yahweh descended on it in fire; and its smoke ascended like the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mountain quaked greatly.
Translated_sentences: And Mount Sinai was shrinking all, so that the Lord descended upon it on fire; and there was smoke from it, as smoke from the furnace, and all the mountain was shaking very much.

Sentences_from: Nie strzyżcie w koło włosów głowy waszej, ani brody swojej oszpecajcie.
Sentences_to: (for all these abominations have the men of the land done, that were before you, and the land became defiled);
Translated_sentences: Do not cut your head in the circle of hair, or disfigure your beard.

Sentences_from: A Zacharyjasz, i Jazyjel, i Semiramot, i Jechyjel, i Unni, i Elijab, i Maasejasz, i Benajasz grali na lutniach przy śpiewaniu wysokiem.
Sentences_to: and Zechariah, and Aziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, and Eliab, and Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with stringed instruments set to Alamoth;
Translated_sentences: And Zeharyah, and Jazyjel, and Semiramot, and Yechyjel, and Unni, and Elijab, and Maasejah, and Benaiah played the lutes at the high singing.

Sentences_from: Zatem otworzyły się oczy obojga, i poznali, że byli nagimi; i spletli liście figowe, a poczynili sobie zasłony.
Sentences_to: The eyes of both of them were opened, and they knew that they were naked. They sewed fig leaves together, and made themselves aprons.
Translated_sentences: So they opened the eyes of both, and they knew that they were naked; and they clawed the fig leaves, and they made themselves curtains.

Sentences_from: Albowiem Lewitowie nie mają działu między wami, gdyż kapłaóstwo Pańskie jest dziedzictwo ich; ale Gad, i Ruben, i połowa pokolenia Manasesowego wzięli dziedzictwa swe za Jordanem na wschód słońca, które im oddał Mojżesz, sługa Pański.
Sentences_to: For the Levites have no portion among you; for the priesthood of Yahweh is their inheritance. Gad, Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance beyond the Jordan eastward, which Moses the servant of Yahweh gave them."
Translated_sentences: For the Levites have no department between you, for the priestly of the LORD is their inheritance; but Reptile, and Ruben, and half of the Manassian generation took their inheritance behind Jordan to the sunrise, which Moses, the servant of the Lord, gave them.

Sentences_from: Wyścieć się zaiste dziś nawrócili, i uczyniliście to, co jest dobrego przed oczyma mojemi, żeście ogłosili wolność każdy bliźniemu swemu, i uczyniliście przymierze przed twarzą moją w domu tym, który jest nazwany od imienia mego.
Sentences_to: You had now turned, and had done that which is right in my eyes, in proclaiming liberty every man to his neighbor; and you had made a covenant before me in the house which is called by my name:
Translated_sentences: You have converted today, and you have done what is good before my eyes, that you proclaim liberty to your neighbor, and you have made a covenant before my face in the house to the one who is named from my name.

Sentences_from: I postawił służebnice, i dzieci ich, na przodku, a Liję, i syny jej, za nimi, Rachelę zaś z Józefem na ostatku.
Sentences_to: He put the handmaids and their children in front, Leah and her children after, and Rachel and Joseph at the rear.
Translated_sentences: And he put the handmaids, and their children, on the ancestor, and Lia, and her sons, after them, Rachela with Joseph at the last.

Sentences_from: A gdy był wieczór, wziął Liję, córkę swoję, i wwiódł ją do niego, a Jakób wszedł do niej.
Sentences_to: It happened in the evening, that he took Leah his daughter, and brought her to him. He went in to her.
Translated_sentences: And when the evening was, he took Liya, his daughter, and led her to him, and Jakob walked into her.

Sentences_from: Włóż na Pana sprawy twe, a będą utwierdzone zamysły twoje.
Sentences_to: Commit your deeds to Yahweh, and your plans shall succeed.
Translated_sentences: Put your affairs on you, and thine will be asserted.

Sentences_from: Gdy wypuszczę srogie strzały głodu na zgubę waszę, które wypuszczę, abym was wygubił, a głód zgromadzę przeciwko wam, i złamię wam laskę chleba.
Sentences_to: when I shall send on them the evil arrows of famine, that are for destruction, which I will send to destroy you: and I will increase the famine on you, and will break your staff of bread;
Translated_sentences: When I unleash the crusty arrows of hunger for your undoing, which I will let me forfeit you, and hunger will rally against you, and break your bread stick.

Sentences_from: I rzecz do nich: Tak mówi Pan zastępów, Bóg Izraelski: Pijcie, a popijcie się, owszem zwracajcie, i padajcie tak, abyście nie powstali dla miecza, który Ja poślę między was.
Sentences_to: You shall tell them, Thus says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel: Drink, and be drunk, vomit, fall, and rise no more, because of the sword which I will send among you.
Translated_sentences: And to them, So says the Lord of the deputies, God of Israel: Drink, and drink yourselves, yes return, and fall so that you will not rise for the sword which I will send between you.

Sentences_from: Owszem, miernie go karał, i w ten czas, gdy go wypychał i gdy go nieprzyjaciel wiatrem swoim gwałtownym w dzień wschodniego wiatru, zabierał.
Sentences_to: In measure, when you send them away, you contend with them. He has removed them with his rough blast in the day of the east wind.
Translated_sentences: Yes, he was punishing him mediocre, and in that time when he pushed him out, and when he was unfriend by the wind in his violent day, he would take away.

Sentences_from: Tedy wstawszy rano sługa męża Bożego, wyszedł, a oto wojsko otoczyło miasto, i konie, i wozy. I rzekł sługa jego do niego: Ach panie mój! Cóż mamy czynić?
Sentences_to: When the servant of the man of God had risen early, and gone out, behold, an army with horses and chariots was around the city. His servant said to him, "Alas, my master! What shall we do?"
Translated_sentences: Tedy will get up in the morning the servant of God's husband, leave, and behold the military encircled the city, and horses, and wagons. And his servant said unto him, Ah my Lord! What are we supposed to do?

Sentences_from: A gdy się najadł Booz i napił, i rozweseliło się serce jego, poszedł a układł się przy stogu; przyszła też i ona po cichu, a odkrywszy płaszcz z nóg jego, układła się.
Sentences_to: When Boaz had eaten and drunk, and his heart was merry, he went to lie down at the end of the heap of grain. She came softly, uncovered his feet, and laid her down.
Translated_sentences: And when Booz raided and drank, and his heart was cheered up, he went and he laid out by the pile; she came, and she quietly, and having discovered the coat from his legs, she laid out.

Sentences_from: Potem posłał Jakób posły przed sobą do Ezawa, brata swego, do ziemi Seir, do krainy Edomskiej.
Sentences_to: He commanded them, saying, "This is what you shall tell my lord, Esau: 'This is what your servant, Jacob, says. I have lived as a foreigner with Laban, and stayed until now.
Translated_sentences: Then he sent Jakob MP before him to Esau, his brother, to the land of Seir, to the land of Edom.

Sentences_from: A gniewam się bardzo na te narody, które używają pokoju; bo gdym się Ja trochę zagniewał, tedy one pomagały do złego.
Sentences_to: I am very angry with the nations that are at ease; for I was but a little displeased, but they added to the calamity."
Translated_sentences: And I am very angry at those nations who use peace; for I have fretted a little, then they have helped to evil.

Sentences_from: Potem rzekł Pan do Jozuego: Dzisiajm zdjął pohaóbienie Egipskie z was; i nazwano imię miejsca onego Galgal, aż do dnia tego.
Sentences_to: Yahweh said to Joshua, "Today I have rolled away the reproach of Egypt from off you." Therefore the name of that place was called Gilgal, to this day.
Translated_sentences: Then the LORD said unto Joshua, Todaym took off the apostasy of Egypt from you; and the name of the place Galgal was called, until the day of this.

Sentences_from: Przyłóż trąbę do ust twoich, a rzecz: Oto leci na dom Pański jako orzeł, przeto, że przestąpili przymierze moje, a przeciwko zakonowi mojemu wykroczyli.
Sentences_to: When I would heal Israel, then the iniquity of Ephraim is uncovered, also the wickedness of Samaria; for they commit falsehood, and the thief enters in, and the gang of robbers ravages outside.
Translated_sentences: Put the proboscis to thy mouth, and the thing: Behold it flies upon the house of the Lord as an eagle, so that they have ceased my covenant, and against my order have offended.

Sentences_from: Przetoż obróciłem się do tego, abym się przypatrywał mądrośći, i szaleństwu, i głupstwu; (bo cóżby człowiek czynił ten, który nastanie po królu? to, co już inni czynili.)
Sentences_to: I turned myself to consider wisdom, madness, and folly: for what can the king's successor do? Just that which has been done long ago.
Translated_sentences: I turned to the fact that I would look at wisdom, and madness, and foolishness; (for what man would do the one who would come after the king? what others have already done.)

Sentences_from: Którego nie zabrał Nabuchodonozor, król Babiloński, gdy w niewolę prowadził Jechonijasza, syna Joakimowego, króla Judzkiego, z Jeruzalemu do Babilonu, i wszystkich przedniejszych, z Judy i z Jeruzalemu:
Sentences_to: which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon didn't take, when he carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem;
Translated_sentences: Which was not taken by Nebuchadnezzar, King of Babylon, when captive he led Yechoniyah, son of Joakim, King of Judean, from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the foreigns, from Judah and from Jerusalem:

Sentences_from: A Arfachsad spłodził Selecha, a Selech spłodził Hebera.
Sentences_to: Arpachshad became the father of Shelah, and Shelah became the father of Eber.
Translated_sentences: And Arfachsad begat Selech, and Selech begat Heber.

Sentences_from: A tak mieszkaliśmy w dolinie przeciw Betfegor.
Sentences_to: So we stayed in the valley over against Beth Peor.
Translated_sentences: And that's how we lived in the valley against Betfegor.

Sentences_from: Sromoty ojca twego, także sromoty matki twojej nie odkryjesz; matką twoją jest, nie odkryjesz sromoty jej.
Sentences_to: They shall no more sacrifice their sacrifices to the goat idols, after which they play the prostitute. This shall be a statute forever to them throughout their generations.'
Translated_sentences: Thy father's steepness, thou shalt not discover thy mother; thy mother is, thou shalt not discover her vulva.

Sentences_from: To gdy się stało, dano znać Józefowi: Oto, ojciec twój zachorzał; który wziąwszy dwóch synów swoich z sobą, Manasesa i Efraima, jechał do niego.
Sentences_to: It happened after these things, that someone said to Joseph, "Behold, your father is sick." He took with him his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim.
Translated_sentences: It was when it happened that Joseph was let know: Behold, thy father had become wary; who, having taken his two sons with him, Manases and Ephraim, rode to him.

Sentences_from: Błogosławieni, którzy strzegą sądu, a czynią sprawiedliwość na każdy czas.
Sentences_to: Blessed are those who keep justice. Blessed is one who does what is right at all times.
Translated_sentences: Blessed, who guard the court, and do justice for every time.

Sentences_from: Z Hemana: Synowie Hemanowi: Bukkijasz, Matanijasz, Husyjel, Zebuel, i Jerymot, Chananijasz, Chanani, Eliata, Gieddalty, i Romantyjeser, i Jasbekassa, Malloty, Hotyr, Machazyjot.
Sentences_to: Of Heman; the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, and Romamti-Ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.
Translated_sentences: From Hemana: The sons of Heman: Bukkyah, Mataniyah, Husyjel, Zebuel, and Jerymot, Khananiyah, Chanani, Eliata, Gieddalty, and Romantyjeser, and Jasbekassa, Malloty, Hotyr, Machazyiot.

Sentences_from: I oderwałem królestwo od domu Dawidowego, a dałem je tobie, tyś jednak nie był jako sługa mój Dawid, który strzegł rozkazania mego, i który chodził za mną całem sercem swojem, to tylko czyniąc, co jest dobrego w oczach moich;
Sentences_to: and tore the kingdom away from the house of David, and gave it you; and yet you have not been as my servant David, who kept my commandments, and who followed me with all his heart, to do that only which was right in my eyes,
Translated_sentences: And I took the kingdom away from the house of David, and I gave it to thee; however, thou was not as a servant my David, who guarded my command, and who followed me with his whole heart, only doing what is good in my eyes;

Sentences_from: Arod, od którego dom Arodytów; Aryjel, od którego dom Aryjelitów.
Sentences_to: of Arod, the family of the Arodites; of Areli, the family of the Arelites.
Translated_sentences: Arod, from whom the house of the Arodites; Aryjel, from whom the house of the Aryjelites.

Sentences_from: Jako cieó, który ustępuje, uchodzić muszę; zganiają mię jako szaraóczę.
Sentences_to: I fade away like an evening shadow. I am shaken off like a locust.
Translated_sentences: As a child who subsides, I must go away; they bend me as a greyboy.

Sentences_from: I stało się, jakoby po trzech miesiącach, powiedziano Judzie, mówiąc: Dopuściła się nierządu Tamar, synowa twoja, a oto, już brzemienna jest z nierządu. Tedy rzekł Judas: Wywiedźcie ją, aby była spalona.
Sentences_to: It happened about three months later, that it was told Judah, saying, "Tamar, your daughter-in-law, has played the prostitute; and moreover, behold, she is with child by prostitution." Judah said, "Bring her out, and let her be burnt."
Translated_sentences: And it happened, as after three months, Judah was told, saying, “Tamar, thy daughter-in-law, and behold, she is already burdened with misgovernment. Tedy said Judas, Take her out to be burnt.

Sentences_from: Postanowiłem przymierze z wybranym moim: przysiągłem Dawidowi, słudze swemu,
Sentences_to: 'I will establish your seed forever, and build up your throne to all generations.'" Selah.
Translated_sentences: I made a covenant with my chosen one: I swore to David, my servant,

Sentences_from: Lecz on nie chciał usłuchać głosu jej, ale zmógłszy ją, uczynił jej gwałt, i leżał z nią.
Sentences_to: However he would not listen to her voice; but being stronger than she, he forced her, and lay with her.
Translated_sentences: But he would not listen to her voice, but he would have made her rape, and lay with her.

Sentences_from: Niechże będą zawstydzeni wszyscy, którzy służą obrazom, którzy się chlubią w bałwanach; kłaniajcież mu się wszyscy bogowie.
Sentences_to: Let all them be shamed who serve engraved images, who boast in their idols. Worship him, all you gods!
Translated_sentences: It will be embarrassed that all those who serve images who enjoy themselves in snowmen; bow to him all the gods.

Sentences_from: Aby sądził lud twój w sprawiedliwości, a ubogich twoich w prawości.
Sentences_to: He will judge your people with righteousness, and your poor with justice.
Translated_sentences: To judge your people in righteousness, and your poor in righteousness.

Sentences_from: Leniwego żądość zabija; bo ręce jego robić nie chcą.
Sentences_to: The desire of the sluggard kills him, for his hands refuse to labor.
Translated_sentences: Lazy desire kills; for his hands do not want to do.

Sentences_from: Któż uwierzył kazaniu naszemu, a ramię Pańskie komu objawione jest?
Sentences_to: Who has believed our message? To whom has the arm of Yahweh been revealed?
Translated_sentences: Who believed our sermon, and the Lord's arm to whom it is revealed?

Sentences_from: Pieśó wyuczająca podana Asafowi. Słuchaj, ludu mój! zakonu mego; nakłoócież uszów swych do słów ust moich.
Sentences_to: < < A contemplation by Asaph. > > Hear my teaching, my people. Turn your ears to the words of my mouth.
Translated_sentences: A teaching song given to Assaf. Listen, my people! of my order; to bring my ears to the words of my mouth.

Sentences_from: A ściągnąwszy Dawid rękę swą do torby, wyjął z niej kamień, i cisnął z procy, a ugodził Filistyóczyka w czoło jego, tak iż utknął kamień w czole jego, i padł twarzą swą na ziemię.
Sentences_to: David put his hand in his bag, took a stone, and slung it, and struck the Philistine in his forehead; and the stone sank into his forehead, and he fell on his face to the earth.
Translated_sentences: And, having taken his hand down to his bag, he took out a stone from it, and pressed from the slingshot, and he agreed the Philistian to his forehead, so that he stuck a stone in his forehead, and fell his face on the ground.

Sentences_from: A oni nie wiedzieli, żeby rozumiał Józef; bo tłumacz był między nimi.
Sentences_to: They didn't know that Joseph understood them; for there was an interpreter between them.
Translated_sentences: And they did not know that Joseph understood; for the translator was between them.

Sentences_from: Synowie tedy Izraelscy przywiodą ofiary swoje, które zabijali na polu; przywiodą je Panu do drzwi namiotu zgromadzenia, do kapłana; a tak niechaj sprawują ofiary spokojne Panu.
Sentences_to: He shall take from the congregation of the children of Israel two male goats for a sin offering, and one ram for a burnt offering.
Translated_sentences: The sons of Israel will bring their sacrifices, which they have killed in the field; they will bring them to the Lord to the door of the tent of the congregation, to the priest; and so do the sacrifices peaceful to the Lord.

Sentences_from: A jeźli jest biała głowa szacunek twój będzie trzydzieści syklów,
Sentences_to: If it is a female, then your valuation shall be thirty shekels.
Translated_sentences: And the skies is white head respect thy will be thirty hisles,

Sentences_from: I lekceż sobie ważysz pociechy Boskie? i maszże jeszcze co tak skrytego w sobie?
Sentences_to: Are the consolations of God too small for you, even the word that is gentle toward you?
Translated_sentences: And you underestimate God's comforts? And what's so secretive about yourself?

Sentences_from: Tedy będę mówił, a nie będę się go bał; bom ja nie jest taki sam u siebie.
Sentences_to: then I would speak, and not fear him, for I am not so in myself.
Translated_sentences: Tedy I will speak, and I will not be afraid of him; bom I am not the same at my place.

Sentences_from: Była też jeszcze wojna z Filistynami, gdzie zabił Elchana, syn Jairowy, Lachmiego, brata Golijata Gietejczyka, którego drzewce u włóczni było nawój tkacki.
Sentences_to: There was again war with the Philistines; and Elhanan the son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver's beam.
Translated_sentences: There was also a war with the Philistines, where he killed Elchan, son of Jairowa, Lachmi, brother of Golijat Gietejczyk, whose trees at the spear were a weaving nave.

Sentences_from: Zaprawdę pomija człowiek jako cieó; zaprawdę próżno się kłopocze, zgromadza, a nie wie, kto to pobierze.
Sentences_to: Now, Lord, what do I wait for? My hope is in you.
Translated_sentences: Indeed, he omits man as a part; he vainly troubles, he accumulates, and does not know who will charge it.

Sentences_from: I rzekł: Cóż to za miasta, któreś mi dał, bracie mój? I nazwał je ziemią Chabul, aż do dnia tego.
Sentences_to: He said, "What cities are these which you have given me, my brother?" He called them the land of Cabul to this day.
Translated_sentences: And he said, What are these cities that one gave me, my brother? And he called them the land of Chabul until the day of this.

Sentences_from: Czego gdy się Danijel dowiedział, że był podany na piśmie, wszedł do domu swego, gdzie otworzone były okna w pokoju jego przeciw Jeruzalemowi, a trzy kroć przez dzień klękał na kolana swoje, i modlił się, a chwałę dawał Bogu swemu, jako to był z wykł przedtem czynić.
Sentences_to: Then these men assembled together, and found Daniel making petition and supplication before his God.
Translated_sentences: What when Danijel found out that he was given in writing, he entered his house, where windows were opened in his room against Jerusalem, and three times for a day he kneeled his knees, and prayed, and glory he gave to his God, as he was to do before.

Sentences_from: Którzy myślą, jakoby z pamięci wywieść ludowi mojemu imię moje snami swemi, które powiadają każdy bliźniemu swemu, jako zapomnieli ojcowie ich na imię moje dla Baala.
Sentences_to: who think to cause my people to forget my name by their dreams which they tell every man to his neighbor, as their fathers forgot my name for Baal.
Translated_sentences: Who think from memory to give my people my name my swemi dreams, which say to each neighbor, as forgot their fathers in my name for Baal.

Sentences_from: Bo wykupił Pan Jakóba; przeto wybawi go z ręki tego, który jest mocniejszy nadeó.
Sentences_to: For Yahweh has ransomed Jacob, and redeemed him from the hand of him who was stronger than he.
Translated_sentences: For he bought out the Lord of Jakób; therefore, he will deliver him from the hand of the one who is more powerful nadeó.

Sentences_from: I posłał Elijakima, sprawcę domu swego, i Sobnę pisarza, i starszych z kapłanów obleczonych w wory, do Izajasza proroka, syna Amosowego.
Sentences_to: He sent Eliakim, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz.
Translated_sentences: And he sent Elijakim, the perpetrator of his house, and Sobna the writer, and the elders of the priests caked in sacks, to Isaiah the prophet, son of Amos.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł król do niewiasty: Idź do domu twego, a ja skażę za tobą.
Sentences_to: The king said to the woman, "Go to your house, and I will give a command concerning you."
Translated_sentences: Tedy said the king unto the woman, Go to thy house, and I will contaminate behind you.

Sentences_from: Ciągnijmy przeciwko ziemi Judzkiej, a utrapmy ją leżą, i oderwijmy ją do siebie, a postanówmy króla w pośród niej, syna Tabealowego.
Sentences_to: "Let's go up against Judah, and tear it apart, and let's divide it among ourselves, and set up a king in its midst, even the son of Tabeel."
Translated_sentences: Let us pull against the land of Judah, and let us lay it, and break it back to ourselves, and let us decide the king in the midst of it, the son of Tabeal.

Sentences_from: I ujrzał wozy, i dwa rzędy jezdnych; wozy, które osły, i wozy, które wielbłądy ciągnęły: i przypatrywał się im z wielką bardzo pilnością.
Sentences_to: When he sees a troop, horsemen in pairs, a troop of donkeys, a troop of camels, he shall listen diligently with great attentiveness."
Translated_sentences: And he saw the wagons, and the two rows of roadways; the wagons that donkeys, and the wagons that the camels pulled: and he stared at them with great urgency.

Sentences_from: A tak posłał ten, który był sprawcą domu, i ten, który był sprawcą miasta, i starsi, i ci, którzy wychowywali syny królewskie, do Jehu, mówiąc: Słudzyśmy twoi, a co nam rozkażesz, uczynimy. Nie postanowiemy króla żadnego; co dobrego jest w oczach twoich, czyń.
Sentences_to: He who was over the household, and he who was over the city, the elders also, and those who raised the children, sent to Jehu, saying, "We are your servants, and will do all that you ask us. We will not make any man king. You do that which is good in your eyes."
Translated_sentences: And so sent the one who was the perpetrator of the house, and the one who was the perpetrator of the city, and the elders, and those who raised the king's sons, to Jehu, saying, We serve yours, and what you will order us, we will do. We shall not decide the king of any; what good is in thy eyes, do.

Sentences_from: I była gałka pod dwiema prętami jego, także gałka pod drugiemi dwiema prętami jego, i zaś gałka pod innemi dwiema prętami jego; tak było pod sześcią prętów wychodzących z niego.
Sentences_to: and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, for the six branches going out of it.
Translated_sentences: And there was a knob under two bars of his, also a knob under the other two bars of his, and a knob under the other two bars of his; so was under the six bars coming out of him.

Sentences_from: Synowie też Merarego: Maheli, i Muzy. Teć są domy Lewiego według rodzajów ich.
Sentences_to: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their generations.
Translated_sentences: Merary's sons, too: Maheli, and Muses. Teć are Levi's houses according to their types.

Sentences_from: Tedy zapalczywość Boża przypadła na nich, i pobił tłustych ich, a przedniejszych z Izraela poraził.
Sentences_to: when the anger of God went up against them, killed some of their fattest, and struck down the young men of Israel.
Translated_sentences: The Tedy avaricacy of God fell upon them, and he beat the fat of them, and the foreigns of Israel inflicted them.

Sentences_from: Większa część ludzi przechwala się uczynnością swoją; ale w samej rzeczy, któż takiego znajdzie?
Sentences_to: Many men claim to be men of unfailing love, but who can find a faithful man?
Translated_sentences: A greater proportion of people brags about their work; but in the very thing, who will find it?

Sentences_from: Drogę kłamliwą oddal odemnie, a zakonem twoim udaruj mię.
Sentences_to: Keep me from the way of deceit. Grant me your law graciously!
Translated_sentences: By dear dear dear, and by your order, thwart me.

Sentences_from: A w onych czterech były kuchnie w około, także ogniska poczynione w onych kuchniach w około.
Sentences_to: There was a wall around in them, around the four, and boiling places were made under the walls all around.
Translated_sentences: And in these four were kitchens in about, also bonfires made in these kitchens in about.

Sentences_from: I czynili Izraelscy synowie złe przed oczyma Pańskiemi: zapomniawszy Pana, Boga swego, służyli Baalom, i święconym gajom.
Sentences_to: The children of Israel did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and forgot Yahweh their God, and served the Baals and the Asheroth.
Translated_sentences: And they did Israel's sons evil before the eyes of the LORD: having forgotten the LORD, their God, they served the Baals, and the holy groves.

Sentences_from: Tedy szedł Ezaw do Ismaela, i pojął mimo inne żony swoje, Mahalatę córkę Ismaela, syna Abrahamowego, siostrę Nebajotowę, sobie za żonę.
Sentences_to: Esau went to Ishmael, and took, besides the wives that he had, Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael, Abraham's son, the sister of Nebaioth, to be his wife.
Translated_sentences: Tedy went Esau to Ishmael, and he fathomed, despite his other wives, Mahalata daughter of Ishmael, son of Abrahamic, sister of Nebajotova, himself as his wife.

Sentences_from: A oto, Saul szedł za wołami z pola, i rzekł Saul: Cóż się stało ludowi, iż płacze? I powiedzieli mu wszystkie słowa mężów z Jabes.
Sentences_to: Behold, Saul came following the oxen out of the field; and Saul said, "What ails the people that they weep?" They told him the words of the men of Jabesh.
Translated_sentences: And behold, Saul followed the oxen from the field, and Saul said, What happened to the people to cry? And they told him all the words of the husbands of Jabes.

Sentences_from: Także też uczyni siódmego dnia tegoż miesiąca za każdego, który z omyłki i z prostoty zgrzeszył; tak oczyścicie dom.
Sentences_to: So you shall do on the seventh [day] of the month for everyone who errs, and for him who is simple: so you shall make atonement for the house.
Translated_sentences: He will also make the seventh day of this month for everyone who has sin-binned and simplicity; so you will clean the house.

Sentences_from: A napiszę na tablicach onych słowa, które były na tablicach pierwszych, któreś stłukł, a włożysz je do skrzyni.
Sentences_to: I will write on the tables the words that were on the first tables which you broke, and you shall put them in the ark."
Translated_sentences: And I'll write on the boards of the words that were on the first plates he broke, and you'll put them in the crate.

Sentences_from: On i lud jego z nimi, najsrożsi z narodów, przywiedzeni będą na wytracenie tej ziemi; bo dobędą mieczów swych przeciw Egiptowi, i napełnią ziemię pobitymi.
Sentences_to: He and his people with him, the terrible of the nations, shall be brought in to destroy the land; and they shall draw their swords against Egypt, and fill the land with the slain.
Translated_sentences: He and his people with them, the most of the nations, will be brought to the forfeit of this land; for they will make their swords against Egypt, and fill the earth with the beatings.

Sentences_from: U nóg jej skurczył się, padł, leżał; u nóg jej skurczył się, padł; kędy się skurczył, tam upadł zabity.
Sentences_to: At her feet he bowed, he fell, he lay. At her feet he bowed, he fell. Where he bowed, there he fell down dead.
Translated_sentences: At her feet, he shrunk, fell, lay; at her feet he shrunk, fell; the bark shrunk, there he fell killed.

Sentences_from: A teraz co za sprawę masz na drogach Egipskich, iż pijesz wodę z Nilu? albo co masz za sprawę na drogach Assyryjczyków, iż pijesz wodę z rzeki ich?
Sentences_to: Now what have you to do in the way to Egypt, to drink the waters of the Shihor? Or what have you to do in the way to Assyria, to drink the waters of the River?
Translated_sentences: Now what kind of thing do you have on the Egyptian roads that you drink water from the Nile? or what do you have on the roads of Assyrians that you drink water from their river?

Sentences_from: A tak pobili Żydzi wszystkich nieprzyjaciół swoich, mieczem ich mordując, i tracąc, i niszcząc, a czyniąc z tymi, co ich nienawidzieli, według upodobania swego.
Sentences_to: The Jews struck all their enemies with the stroke of the sword, and with slaughter and destruction, and did what they wanted to those who hated them.
Translated_sentences: And so they beat the Jews of all their enemies, slaughtering them with a sword, and losing them, and destroying them, and doing what they hated them, to their liking.

Sentences_from: Przetoż był głód wielki w Samaryi; albowiem ją było oblężono, tak, iż głowę oślą sprzedawano za ośmdziesiąt srebrników, a czwartą część miary gnoju gołębiego za pięć srebrników.
Sentences_to: There was a great famine in Samaria. Behold, they besieged it, until a donkey's head was sold for eighty pieces of silver, and the fourth part of a kab of dove's dung for five pieces of silver.
Translated_sentences: So the famine was great in Samarya; for it was besieged, so that the head was sold for twenty-silvers, and the fourth part of the measure of dove dung for five silvers.

Sentences_from: Ty wysłuchaj z nieba, z miejsca mieszkania twego, a odpuść, i uczyń, i oddaj każdemu według wszelkich dróg jego, które znasz w sercu jego; bo ty, ty sam znasz serca wszystkich synów ludzkich;
Sentences_to: then hear in heaven, your dwelling place, and forgive, and do, and render to every man according to all his ways, whose heart you know; (for you, even you only, know the hearts of all the children of men;)
Translated_sentences: Thou hear from heaven, from the place of thy dwelling, and do, and give back to everyone according to all his ways which you know in the heart of his; for thou, thou yourself know the hearts of all men's sons;

Sentences_from: Albowiem on rzekł, i stało się; on rozkazał, a stanęło.
Sentences_to: For he spoke, and it was done. He commanded, and it stood firm.
Translated_sentences: For he said, and it happened; he commanded, and it stood.

Sentences_from: Wspomnij proszę, kto kiedy niewinny zginął? albo gdzieby ludzie szczerzy zniszczeli?
Sentences_to: "Remember, now, whoever perished, being innocent? Or where were the upright cut off?
Translated_sentences: Mention please, who when the innocent died? or where would people sincere destroy?

Sentences_from: Karyjot wzięte będzie, i zamki wzięte będą, a serce mocarzów Moabskich dnia onego będzie jako serce niewiasty bolejącej.
Sentences_to: Kerioth is taken, and the strongholds are seized, and the heart of the mighty men of Moab at that day shall be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
Translated_sentences: Karyot will be taken, and the castles will be taken, and the heart of the Moabian powers of the day will be as the heart of the woman of the pained.

Sentences_from: Wszystkie także dziesięciny ziemi z nasienia ziemi, z owocu drzewa, Pańskie są; bo poświęcone są Panu.
Sentences_to: I will destroy your high places, and cut down your incense altars, and cast your dead bodies upon the bodies of your idols; and my soul will abhor you.
Translated_sentences: All tithes of the earth from the semen of the earth, from the fruit of the tree, the Lord are; for they are consecrated to the Lord.

Sentences_from: Potem odszedłszy stamtąd dalej przyjdziesz aż na pole Tabor; i spotkają cię tam trzej mężowie idący do Boga, do domu Bożego, jeden niesie troje koźląt, a drugi niesie trzy bochny chleba, a trzeci niesie łagiew wina;
Sentences_to: "Then you shall go on forward from there, and you shall come to the oak of Tabor; and three men shall meet you there going up to God to Bethel, one carrying three young goats, and another carrying three loaves of bread, and another carrying a bottle of wine:
Translated_sentences: Then you will go from there further you will come to the field of Tabor; and you will be met by three husbands going to Allah, to the house of God, one carries three goats, and the other carries three loaves of bread, and the third carries the mitigation of wine;

Sentences_from: A wsi ich były: Etam, i Hain, Remnon, i Tochen i Asan przy tych pięciu miastach;
Sentences_to: Their villages were Etam, and Ain, Rimmon, and Tochen, and Ashan, five cities;
Translated_sentences: And their villages were: Etam, and Hain, Remnon, and Tochen and Asan at these five cities;

Sentences_from: Wtem gdy się sługa twój zabawił tem i owem, oto on zniknął. Tedy rzekł do niego król Izraelski: Taki jest sąd twój, sameś się osądził.
Sentences_to: As your servant was busy here and there, he was gone." The king of Israel said to him, "So your judgment shall be; you yourself have decided it."
Translated_sentences: Then when your servant entertained him and his own, behold he disappeared. Tedy said unto him the King of Israel: Such is thy judgment, you have judged yourself.

Sentences_from: Od mnóstwa koni jego okryje cię proch ich; od grzmotu jezdnych i kar i wozów poruszą się mury twoje, gdy wchodzić będzie w bramy twoje, jako wchodzą do miasta zburzonego.
Sentences_to: By reason of the abundance of his horses their dust shall cover you: your walls shall shake at the noise of the horsemen, and of the wagons, and of the chariots, when he shall enter into your gates, as men enter into a city in which is made a breach.
Translated_sentences: From the abundance of horses his dust will cover you; from the thunder of roadways and punishments and carts, thy walls will move, as they enter thy gates, as they enter the city demolished.

Sentences_from: Tak umiejętność mądrości duszy twojej, jeźliże ją znajdziesz; onać będzie nagrodą, a nadzieja twoja nie będzie wycięta.
Sentences_to: so you shall know wisdom to be to your soul; if you have found it, then there will be a reward, your hope will not be cut off.
Translated_sentences: So the skill of wisdom of your soul, shall you find it; it shall be a reward, and thy hope shall not be cut.

Sentences_from: Praca sprawiedliwego jest ku żywotowi; ale dochód niepobożnych jest ku grzechowi.
Sentences_to: The labor of the righteous leads to life. The increase of the wicked leads to sin.
