Translated_sentences: The work of the righteous is towards life; but the income of the impious is towards sin.

Sentences_from: Tak mówi Pan: Dla trzech występków Edoma, owszem, dla czterech, nie przepuszczę mu, przeto, że zepsowawszy w sobie wszelaką litość swoję prześladuje mieczem brata swego, a gniewem swym ustawicznie pała, owszem, zapalczywość jego rozsila się bez przestania;
Sentences_to: Thus says Yahweh: "For three transgressions of Edom, yes, for four, I will not turn away its punishment; because he pursued his brother with the sword, and cast off all pity, and his anger raged continually, and he kept his wrath forever;
Translated_sentences: So says the LORD: For the three misdeeds of Edom, yes, for four, I shall not pass him, so that, having spoiled all mercy in itself, his pity is persecuting his brother's sword, and in his wrath it continues to burn, yes, his inflammation spreads without cease;

Sentences_from: Pana, Boga twego, będziesz się bał, jemu służył, przy nim trwał, i przez imię jego przysięgał.
Sentences_to: You shall fear Yahweh your God; you shall serve him; and you shall cling to him, and you shall swear by his name.
Translated_sentences: Your Lord, thy God, thou shalt fear, serve him, with him endure, and by his name swear.

Sentences_from: A jeźliby kto zabił bydlę wróci inne bydlę za bydlę.
Sentences_to: You shall present with the bread seven lambs without blemish a year old, one young bull, and two rams. They shall be a burnt offering to Yahweh, with their meal offering, and their drink offerings, even an offering made by fire, of a sweet aroma to Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: And who killed the cattle would come back other cattle for cattle.

Sentences_from: Gdy rozdzielił dziedzictwa Najwyższy narodom, a rozsadził syny Adamowe, położył granice narodom według liczby synów Izraelskich;
Sentences_to: You shall return and obey the voice of Yahweh, and do all his commandments which I command you this day.
Translated_sentences: When he separated the heritage of the Supreme nations, and unseeded the sons of Adam, he laid the borders to the nations according to the number of sons of Israel;

Sentences_from: Aleć on też jest mądry, przetoż przywiedzie złe, a słów swoich nie odmieni; lecz powstanie przeciw domowi złośników i przeciwko ratunkowi tych, którzy broją nieprawość.
Sentences_to: Yet he also is wise, and will bring disaster, and will not call back his words, but will arise against the house of the evildoers, and against the help of those who work iniquity.
Translated_sentences: But he is wise too, and he will bring evil, and he will not change his words; but he will rise against the house of victors and against the rescue of those who broad iniquity.

Sentences_from: Gdy Izrael obierał sobie bogi nowe, tedy bywała wojna w bramach; tarczy jednak nie było widać, ani drzewca między czterdziestą tysięcy w Izraelu.
Sentences_to: They chose new gods. Then war was in the gates. Was there a shield or spear seen among forty thousand in Israel?
Translated_sentences: When Israel peeled new gods, then there was war in the gates; however, the shield could not be seen, nor a tree between forty thousand in Israel.

Sentences_from: Wspominam sobie i w nocy na imię twoje, Panie! i strzegę zakonu twego.
Sentences_to: I have remembered your name, Yahweh, in the night, and I obey your law.
Translated_sentences: I mention to myself and at night in your name, Lord! and I guard thy order.

Sentences_from: Dziesięć także tysięcy żywo pojmali synowie Judzcy, i przywiedli ich na wierzch skały, i zrzucili ich z wierzchu skały, aż się wszyscy porozpukali.
Sentences_to: The king and Jehoiada gave it to such as did the work of the service of the house of Yahweh; and they hired masons and carpenters to restore the house of Yahweh, and also such as worked iron and brass to repair the house of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: Ten thousand were also captured by the Judean sons, and brought them to the top of the rock, and dropped them off the top of the rock until they were all sprung.

Sentences_from: Jegoż jest morze, bo je on uczynił; i ziemia, którą ręce jego ukształtowały.
Sentences_to: The sea is his, and he made it. His hands formed the dry land.
Translated_sentences: The hedgehog is the sea, for he has made them; and the land which his hands have shaped.

Sentences_from: Uczynił i drążki z drzewa sytym, a powlókł je złotem.
Sentences_to: He made poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold.
Translated_sentences: He made and sticks from the tree sowing, and coated them with gold.

Sentences_from: Tedy Pan zstąpił, aby oglądał miasto ono, i wieżą, którą budowali synowie ludzcy.
Sentences_to: Yahweh came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men built.
Translated_sentences: Tedy Pan came down to watch the city it, and the tower the human sons built.

Sentences_from: Mów do synów Izraelskich, i rzecz im: Jam jest Pan, Bóg wasz.
Sentences_to: "Speak to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all the children of Israel, and say to them: 'This is the thing which Yahweh has commanded,
Translated_sentences: Speak to the sons of Israel, and the thing to them: I am the LORD your God.

Sentences_from: Oto się teraz gotuję do prawa, i wiem, że usprawiedliwiony będę.
Sentences_to: See now, I have set my cause in order. I know that I am righteous.
Translated_sentences: Here I am now cooking into law, and I know I will be justified.

Sentences_from: W domy synów Manasesa, syna Józefowego poszły za mąż; i tak zostało dziedzictwo ich przy pokoleniu domu ojca ich.
Sentences_to: They were married into the families of the sons of Manasseh the son of Joseph; and their inheritance remained in the tribe of the family of their father.
Translated_sentences: In the houses of the sons of Manases, the son of Joseph were married; and so was the inheritance of them at the generation of their father's house.

Sentences_from: Uprzedzam cię na świtaniu i wołam, na słowo twoje oczekując.
Sentences_to: I rise before dawn and cry for help. I put my hope in your words.
Translated_sentences: I prejudice you at dawn and call out, at your word expecting.

Sentences_from: Jako muchy zdechłe zasmradzają i psują olejek aptekarski: tak człowieka z mądrości i z sławy zacnago trochę głupstwa oszpeca.
Sentences_to: Dead flies cause the oil of the perfumer to send forth an evil odor; so does a little folly outweigh wisdom and honor.
Translated_sentences: As dead flies, they sour and spoil the apothecary oil: so a man of wisdom and of fame a little foolishness of disfigurement.

Sentences_from: Tak iż wszystkich miast, które Lewitom dacie, będzie czterdzieści i osiem miast i z przedmieściami ich.
Sentences_to: "'This shall be your north border: from the great sea you shall mark out for you Mount Hor;
Translated_sentences: So that all the cities you Levites date will be forty and eight cities and with their suburbs.

Sentences_from: Nie będzie mieszkał w domu moim zdrajca, ten, który mówi kłamstwo, nie ostoi się przed oczyma memi.
Sentences_to: He who practices deceit won't dwell within my house. He who speaks falsehood won't be established before my eyes.
Translated_sentences: He will not live in the house my traitor, the one who tells the lie will not cool down before the eyes of the meme.

Sentences_from: Izraelu! ufaj w Panu; bo on jest pomocnikiem ich i tarczą ich.
Sentences_to: Israel, trust in Yahweh! He is their help and their shield.
Translated_sentences: Israel! trust in the Lord; for he is the helper of them and the shield of them.

Sentences_from: Przetoż wyszedł jeden na pole, aby zbierał zioła, i znalazł macicę polną, a nazbierał z niej owoców polnych pełen płaszcz swój, a przyszedłszy nakrajał ich w garniec kaszy; bo tego nie znali.
Sentences_to: One went out into the field to gather herbs, and found a wild vine, and gathered of it wild gourds his lap full, and came and shred them into the pot of stew; for they didn't recognize them.
Translated_sentences: Hence, one went out into the field to collect herbs, and found the field uterus, and he took the field fruit full of his cloak, and the woulder put them in a bunch of grits; for they did not know it.

Sentences_from: Przytem rzekł Izajasz: Przynieście bryłę fig suchych. Którą przyniósłszy włożyli na wrzód, i zgoił się.
Sentences_to: Behold, I will put a spirit in him, and he will hear news, and will return to his own land. I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land."'"
Translated_sentences: Isaiah said, Bring a lump of dry figs. Which they brought on the ulcer, and agreed.

Sentences_from: A nie mógł się więcej pokrzepić Jeroboam za dni Abijaszowych, i uderzył go Pan, że umarł.
Sentences_to: Jeroboam didn't recover strength again in the days of Abijah. Yahweh struck him, and he died.
Translated_sentences: And he could not rekindle Jeroboam in the Abijash days, and he was struck by the Lord that he died.

Sentences_from: Książę Oolibama, książę Ela, książę Pynon.
Sentences_to: chief Oholibamah, chief Elah, chief Pinon,
Translated_sentences: Prince Oolibama, Prince Ela, Prince of Pynon.

Sentences_from: Banajas też syn Jojady, syn męża rycerskiego, zacny w swych sprawach, z Kabseel; ten zabił dwóch mocarzów Moabskich, tenże szedłszy zabił lwa w pośrodku studni, we dni śnieżne.
Sentences_to: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, he killed the two sons of Ariel of Moab: he went down also and killed a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow.
Translated_sentences: Banajas also the son of Joyada, son of a knightly husband, who was in his affairs, of Kabseel; he killed two Moabian powers, so he killed a lion in the middle of a well, on snow days.

Sentences_from: Kto strzeże przykazania, nie uzna nic złego; i czas i przyczyny zna serce mądrego.
Sentences_to: Whoever keeps the commandment shall not come to harm, and his wise heart will know the time and procedure.
Translated_sentences: Whoever guards the commandment will acknowledge nothing wrong; and time and cause knows the heart of the wise.

Sentences_from: Wyniósł go na wysokie miejsca ziemi, aby używał urodzajów polnych, i uczynił, aby ssał miód z skały i oliwę z opoki twardej;
Sentences_to: Neither is it beyond the sea, that you should say, "Who shall go over the sea for us, and bring it to us, and make us to hear it, that we may do it?"
Translated_sentences: He brought it to the high places of the earth to use field births, and made it suck honey from the rock and olive from the hard pox;

Sentences_from: Owszem, i po wszystkich winnicach będzie narzekanie, gdy przejdę przez pośrodek ciebie, mówi Pan.
Sentences_to: In all vineyards there will be wailing; for I will pass through the midst of you," says Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: Yes, and after all the vineyards there will be grumbling when I pass through the middle of you, says the Lord.

Sentences_from: Ciebie ja, o Boże ojców moich! wysławiam i chwalę, żeś mi dał mądrość i moc, owszem, żeś mi teraz oznajmił to, o cośmy cię prosili; boś nam sen królewski oznajmił.
Sentences_to: I thank you, and praise you, you God of my fathers, who have given me wisdom and might, and have now made known to me what we desired of you; for you have made known to us the king's matter.
Translated_sentences: You me, O God of my fathers! I say and praise that you have given me wisdom and power, that you have now declared it to me, for whatsoever we have asked you; God the king's dream has told us.

Sentences_from: Pieśó stopni. Wołałem do Pana w utrapieniu mojem, a wysłuchał mię.
Sentences_to: < < A Song of Ascents. > > In my distress, I cried to Yahweh. He answered me.
Translated_sentences: A song of degrees. I called to the Lord in my affliction, and he listened to me.

Sentences_from: Bo tak mówi Pan: Spustoszona będzie wszystka ziemia, wszakże końca jeszcze nie uczynię.
Sentences_to: For thus says Yahweh, "The whole land shall be a desolation; yet will I not make a full end.
Translated_sentences: For so says the LORD: All earth will be ravaged, but I will not do the end yet.

Sentences_from: A ruszywszy się z Kades, położyli się obozem na górze Hor, na granicach ziemi Edomskiej.
Sentences_to: The children of Reuben built Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Kiriathaim,
Translated_sentences: And having moved from the Kades, they laid camp on Mount Hor, on the borders of the land of Edomska.

Sentences_from: Gdy się zapalą, uczynię im ucztę, i tak ich upoję, że krzyczeć i snem wiecznym zasnąć muszą, tak, aby nie ocucili, mówi Pan.
Sentences_to: When they are heated, I will make their feast, and I will make them drunken, that they may rejoice, and sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, says Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: When they light up, I will make them a feast, and so humiliate them that they scream and eternal sleep they must fall asleep so that they do not evaluate, says the Lord.

Sentences_from: Tedy odpowiedział Helkijasz i rzekł do Safana pisarza: Znalazłem księgi zakonu w domu Pańskim. I oddał Helkijasz księgę Safanowi.
Sentences_to: He took away the foreign gods, and the idol out of the house of Yahweh, and all the altars that he had built in the mountain of the house of Yahweh, and in Jerusalem, and cast them out of the city.
Translated_sentences: Tedy answered Helkijah and said to Safan the writer: I found the books of the order in the house of the Lord. And he gave Helkijah the book to Safan.

Sentences_from: Poznał tedy wszystek Izrael od Dan aż do Beerseba, iż Samuel był wiernym prorokiem Panu.
Sentences_to: All Israel from Dan even to Beersheba knew that Samuel was established to be a prophet of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: Then he knew all Israel from Dan to Beerseb that Samuel was a faithful prophet to the Lord.

Sentences_from: Dali trupy sług twoich na pokarm ptastwu powietrznemu, ciała świętych twoich bestyjom ziemskim.
Sentences_to: They have given the dead bodies of your servants to be food for the birds of the sky, the flesh of your saints to the animals of the earth.
Translated_sentences: They gave the troupes of your servants to feed the airfowl, the bodies of your saints to the earth beasts.

Sentences_from: Przed Jordanem w ziemi Moabskiej począł Mojżesz wykładać ten zakon, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: Beyond the Jordan, in the land of Moab, began Moses to declare this law, saying,
Translated_sentences: Before Jordan in the Moabian land began Moses to lecture this order, saying:

Sentences_from: Żona też jego Judaja urodziła Jereda, ojca Giedor, i Hebera, ojca Socho, i Jekutyjela, ojca Zanoach. Cić są synowie Betii, córki Faraonowej, którą był pojął Mered.
Sentences_to: His wife the Jewess bore Jered the father of Gedor, and Heber the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah. These are the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took.
Translated_sentences: His wife also gave birth to Jared, Giedor's father, and Heber, Socho's father, and Yekutyjel, Zanoach's father. Thing are the sons of Betia, Pharaonic's daughter, whom he was comprehended by Mered.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Pan do Mojżesza: Nie usłucha was Farao, abym rozmnożył cuda moje w ziemi Egipskiej.
Sentences_to: Yahweh said to Moses, "Pharaoh won't listen to you, that my wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt."
Translated_sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Farao will not listen to you, to breed my miracles in the land of Egypt.

Sentences_from: I aż będzie poddana ziemia ona Panu, a potem się wrócicie, i będziecie bez winy przed Panem i przed Izraelem: tedy wam będzie ta ziemia za osiadłość przed obliczem Pańskiem.
Sentences_to: however the gold, and the silver, the brass, the iron, the tin, and the lead,
Translated_sentences: And until the land is surrendered to the Lord, and then you will return, and you will be without fault before the LORD and before Israel: then there will be this land for settling before the face of the LORD.

Sentences_from: Przeczżeście nie jedli ofiary za grzech na miejscu świętem? albowiem to jest rzecz najświętsza, ponieważ ją wam dano, abyście nosili nieprawość wszystkiego ludu na oczyszczenie ich przed obliczem Pańskiem.
Sentences_to: He presented the meal offering, and filled his hand from there, and burned it upon the altar, besides the burnt offering of the morning.
Translated_sentences: Have you not eaten the sin sacrifice on the site with a holiday? For it is the most sacred thing, because it was given to you, that you bear the iniquity of all people to purify them before the face of the Lord.

Sentences_from: Pierzem swem okryje cię, a pod skrzydłami jego bezpiecznym będziesz; prawda jego tarczą i puklerzem.
Sentences_to: He will cover you with his feathers. Under his wings you will take refuge. His faithfulness is your shield and rampart.
Translated_sentences: He will cover you under his wings, and under his wings you will be safe; the truth with his shield and his knocker.

Sentences_from: Król Taffua jeden; król Hefer jeden.
Sentences_to: the king of Tappuah, one; the king of Hepher, one;
Translated_sentences: King Taffua one; King Hefer one.

Sentences_from: I wino, które uwesela serce człowiecze, od którego się lśni twarz jako od oleju; i chleb, który zatrzymuje żywot ludzki.
Sentences_to: wine that makes glad the heart of man, oil to make his face to shine, and bread that strengthens man's heart.
Translated_sentences: And wine that merges the heart of man, from which the face shines as from oil; and bread that stops human life.

Sentences_from: I Adoraim, i Lachis, i Aseka;
Sentences_to: and Adoraim, and Lachish, and Azekah,
Translated_sentences: And Adoraim, and Lachis, and Aseka;

Sentences_from: Poskoczcie konie, a zagrzmijcie wozy, a niech się ruszą i mocarze, Murzynowie, i Putejczycy noszący tarcz, i Ludymczycy, którzy noszą i ciągną łuk,
Sentences_to: Go up, you horses; and rage, you chariots; and let the mighty men go forth: Cush and Put, who handle the shield; and the Ludim, who handle and bend the bow.
Translated_sentences: Jump the horses, and thunder the wagons, and let them move, and the powers, the Negroes, and the Puteans bearing the shields, and the Lycians who carry and pull the bow,

Sentences_from: Lecz Obededoma i braci ich sześdziesiąt i ośm, Obededoma mówię, syna Jedytunowego, i Hosę, uczynił odźwiernymi.
Sentences_to: and Obed-Edom with their brothers, sixty-eight; Obed-Edom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah to be doorkeepers;
Translated_sentences: But Obededom and their brothers sixty, and Obededom I say, the son of Jeditunus, and Hosa, made the doormen.

Sentences_from: Na wierzchu wysokich miejsc, przy drodze i na rozstaniu dróg stoi.
Sentences_to: On the top of high places by the way, where the paths meet, she stands.
Translated_sentences: On top of the high places, by the road and on the parting of the roads stands.

Sentences_from: Beser na puszczy, w równinie w ziemi Rubenitów, i Ramot w Galaad między Gadyty, i Golam w Bazan między Manassytami.
Sentences_to: Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country, for the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead, for the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan, for the Manassites.
Translated_sentences: Beser on the wilderness, in the plain in the land of the Rubenites, and Ramot in Galaad between the Gadits, and Golam in Bazan between the Manassyits.

Sentences_from: A miast, które dacie z dzierżaw synów Izraelskich, od tych, którzy więcej mają, więcej dacie, a od tych, którzy mniej mają, dacie mniej; każdy według miary dziedzictwa swego, które posiędzie, udzieli z miast swoich Lewitom.
Sentences_to: from Mount Hor you shall mark out to the entrance of Hamath; and the goings out of the border shall be at Zedad;
Translated_sentences: And the cities you will give from the leases of the sons of Israel, from those who have more, more date, and from those who have less, you will give less; each according to the measure of his heritage which he will share, will grant his Levites from the cities.

Sentences_from: I włoży rękę swą na głowę onej ofiary za grzech, i zabije ją na ofiarę za grzech na miejscu, gdzie zabijają ofiary całopalenia.
Sentences_to: He shall lay his hand on the head of the sin offering, and kill it for a sin offering in the place where they kill the burnt offering.
Translated_sentences: And he will put his hand on the head of his sin sacrifice, and kill it for sin sacrifice on a place where they kill the victims of burns.

Sentences_from: A iżby to opowiedziano i obwołano we wszystkich miastach ich, i w Jeruzalemie, mówiąc: Wynijdźcie na górę, a nanoście gałęzia oliwnego, i gałęzia sosnowego, i gałęzia myrtowego, i gałęzia palmowego, i gałęzia drzewa gęstego, abyście poczynili kuczki, jako jest napisane.
Sentences_to: and that they should publish and proclaim in all their cities, and in Jerusalem, saying, "Go out to the mountain, and get olive branches, and branches of wild olive, and myrtle branches, and palm branches, and branches of thick trees, to make booths, as it is written."
Translated_sentences: And that it was told and called out in all their cities, and in Jerusalem, saying, “Get out on top, and the olive branch, and the pine branch, and the myrtic branch, and the palm branch, and the branches of the tree dense, so that you make the kuchki, as it is written.

Sentences_from: I nawrócisz się do Pana, Boga twego, a będziesz posłuszny głosowi jego we wszystkiem, co ja rozkazuję tobie dziś, ty, i synowie twoi, ze wszystkiego serca twego, i ze wszystkiej duszy twojej:
Sentences_to: and all these blessings shall come on you, and overtake you, if you shall listen to the voice of Yahweh your God.
Translated_sentences: And you will convert to the Lord thy God, and you will obey his voice in all that I command you today, you, and thy sons, of all thy heart, and of all thy soul:

Sentences_from: Wzywał tedy Samson Pana, i rzekł: Panie Boże, wspomnij na mię, proszę, a zmocnij mię proszę tylko ten raz; Boże, abym się raz pomścił obu oczu moich nad Filistynami.
Sentences_to: Samson called to Yahweh, and said, "Lord Yahweh, remember me, please, and strengthen me, please, only this once, God, that I may be at once avenged of the Philistines for my two eyes."
Translated_sentences: Then called upon Samson of the Lord, and said, Lord God, mention on me, please, and fortify me only this time; God, that I once avenge both eyes of mine over the Philistines.

Sentences_from: Wyrwał mię od mocnego nieprzyjaciela mego, i od tych, którzy mię mieli w nienawiści, choć byli mocniejszymi nad mię.
Sentences_to: They came on me in the day of my calamity, but Yahweh was my support.
Translated_sentences: He snatched me from my strong enemy, and from those who had me in hatred, though they were more powerful above me.

Sentences_from: Złota, srebra, i miedzi, i żelaza niemasz liczby; wstańże a czyń, a Pan będzie z tobą.
Sentences_to: of the gold, the silver, and the brass, and the iron, there is no number. Arise and be doing, and may Yahweh be with you."
Translated_sentences: Gold, silver, and copper, and iron you have no number; rise and do, and the Lord will be with you.

Sentences_from: A poznajcie dziś (bo nie mówię do synów waszych, którzy nie znali, ani widzieli karania Pana, Boga waszego); wielmożność jego, rękę jego mocną, i ramię jego wyciągnione;
Sentences_to: Know this day: for I don't speak with your children who have not known, and who have not seen the chastisement of Yahweh your God, his greatness, his mighty hand, and his outstretched arm,
Translated_sentences: And recognize today (for I do not speak to your sons, who did not know, nor saw the punishment of the Lord, your God); his multiplicity, his hand strong, and his arm extended;

Sentences_from: Zstąp, a usiądź w prochu, panno, córko Babiloóska! siądź na ziemi, a nie na stolicy, córko Chaldejska! bo cię nie będą więcej nazywać kochanką i rozkosznicą.
Sentences_to: "Come down, and sit in the dust, virgin daughter of Babylon; sit on the ground without a throne, daughter of the Chaldeans: for you shall no more be called tender and delicate.
Translated_sentences: Come down and sit in the dust, Miss, daughter of Babyloósk! sit on the ground, not on the capital, daughter of Chaldean! because they won't call you a mistress and a delight any more.

Sentences_from: A tak przestrzegać będą rozkazania mego, aby nie podlegli grzechowi, i nie pomarli w nim, gdyby się splugawili; Jam Pan, który je poświęcam.
Sentences_to: "'The daughter of any priest, if she profanes herself by playing the prostitute, she profanes her father: she shall be burned with fire.
Translated_sentences: And so I obey my orders not to be subject to sin, and not to die in it if they were to slugger; I am the Lord who sacrifice them.

Sentences_from: Błogosławiony jest mąż, którego ty ćwiczysz, Panie! a zakonu twego uczysz go.
Sentences_to: Blessed is the man whom you discipline, Yah, and teach out of your law;
Translated_sentences: Blessed is the husband whom you exercise, Lord! and thy order you teach him.

Sentences_from: Len tedy i jęczmieó potłuczony jest; bo jęczmieó był niedostały, a len podrastał.
Sentences_to: The flax and the barley were struck, for the barley was in the ear, and the flax was in bloom.
Translated_sentences: The flax then and the barley is broken; for the barley was indelible, and the flax grew.

Sentences_from: I będzie ofiarował Aaron cielca swego na ofiarę za grzech, i uczyni oczyszczenie za się, i za dom swój.
Sentences_to: He who sits on anything whereon the man who has the discharge sat shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
Translated_sentences: And he will offer Aaron the calf his sacrifice for sin, and make cleansing for himself, and for his house.

Sentences_from: I Zabadyjasz, i Arad, i Hader,
Sentences_to: and Zebadiah, and Arad, and Eder,
Translated_sentences: And you'll adhere, and Arad, and Hader,

Sentences_from: A książęta Filistyńskie ciągnęli stami i tysiącami, a Dawid i mężowie jego ciągnęli pozad z Achisem.
Sentences_to: David said to Achish, "Therefore you shall know what your servant will do." Achish said to David, "Therefore will I make you my bodyguard for ever."
Translated_sentences: And the Philistine princes dragged stings and thousands, and David and his husbands pulled a pretense with Achis.

Sentences_from: Nie dawaj snu oczom twoim, ani drzemania powiekom twoim.
Sentences_to: Give no sleep to your eyes, nor slumber to your eyelids.
Translated_sentences: Don't give sleep to your eyes, or nap your eyelids.

Sentences_from: I osiedli ziemię jego, i ziemię Oga, króla Basańskiego, dwóch królów Amorejskich, którzy byli z tej strony Jordanu na wschód słońca;
Sentences_to: They took his land in possession, and the land of Og king of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites, who were beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise;
Translated_sentences: And they will settle his land, and the land of Oga, King of Basan, two Amorean kings, who were from this side of Jordan for sunrise;

Sentences_from: Tedy naradziwszy się Amazyjasz, król Judzki, posłał do Joaza, syna Joachaza, syna Jehu, króla Izraelskiego, mówiąc: Pójdź, a wejrzymy sobie w oczy.
Sentences_to: Now after the death of Jehoiada came the princes of Judah, and made obeisance to the king. Then the king listened to them.
Translated_sentences: Tedy, when Amasiah, King of Judean, sent to Joaz, son of Joachaz, son of Jehu, King of Israel, saying: Go, and we will look into each other's eyes.

Sentences_from: Zebrali się tedy synowie Ammonowi, a położyli się obozem w Galaad; zebrali się też i synowie Izraelscy, a położyli się obozem w Masfa.
Sentences_to: Then the children of Ammon were gathered together, and encamped in Gilead. The children of Israel assembled themselves together, and encamped in Mizpah.
Translated_sentences: Then the sons of Ammon gathered, and laid camp in Galaad; the sons of Israel gathered too, and laid camp in Masfa.

Sentences_from: I rozrzucą je przed słońce, i przed miesiąc, i przed wszystko wojsko niebieskie, które miłują, i którym służą, i za którymi chodzą, i których szukają, i którym się kłaniają; nie pozbierają ich, ani pogrzebią, ale będą miasto gnoju na wierzchu ziem i.
Sentences_to: and they shall spread them before the sun, and the moon, and all the army of the sky, which they have loved, and which they have served, and after which they have walked, and which they have sought, and which they have worshiped: they shall not be gathered, nor be buried, they shall be for dung on the surface of the earth.
Translated_sentences: And they will scatter them before the sun, and before a month, and before all, the army of heaven, which they love, and whom they serve, and for whom they seek, and to whom they bow; they will not strip them, nor bury them, but there will be a city of dung on top of the lands and.

Sentences_from: Ruszyli się potem z Elimu, i przyszło wszystko mnóstwo synów Izraelskich na puszczą Zyn, która leży między Elim i między Synaj, piętnastego dnia miesiąca wtórego po wyjściu ich z ziemi Egipskiej.
Sentences_to: They took their journey from Elim, and all the congregation of the children of Israel came to the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departing out of the land of Egypt.
Translated_sentences: They moved with Elim afterwards, and there came all the many sons of Israel on the release of Zyn, which lies between Eli and between Sinai, on the 15th day of the month after their exit from the land of Egypt.

Sentences_from: I wyleję gorliwość moję na cię, i obejdą się z tobą zapalczywie, nos twój i uszy twoje oberżną, a ostatek twój od miecza polegnie; oni synów twoich i córki twoje pojmają, a ostatek twój ogniem pożarty będzie;
Sentences_to: I will set my jealousy against you, and they shall deal with you in fury; they shall take away your nose and your ears; and your residue shall fall by the sword: they shall take your sons and your daughters; and your residue shall be devoured by the fire.
Translated_sentences: And I will pour my zeal upon thee, and they will do with you incendidly, thy nose and your ears will be obnoxious, and your last of the sword will fall; their sons and your daughters will comprehend, and your last of your fire will be devoured;

Sentences_from: Zabłyśnij błyskawicą, a rozprosz ich; puść strzały twoje, a poraź ich.
Sentences_to: Throw out lightning, and scatter them. Send out your arrows, and rout them.
Translated_sentences: Shine with lightning, and scatter them; let go of thy arrows, and cope them.

Sentences_from: I wspomną na mię, którzy z was zachowani będą między narodami, u krórych będą w pojmaniu, żem ubolewał nad sercem ich wszetecznem, które odstąpiło odemnie, i nad oczyma ich, które nierząd płodziły, chodząc za plugawemi bałwanami swojemi: i omierzną sami sobie dla złości, które czynili we wszystkich obrzydliwościach swoich.
Sentences_to: Those of you that escape shall remember me among the nations where they shall be carried captive, how that I have been broken with their lewd heart, which has departed from me, and with their eyes, which play the prostitute after their idols: and they shall loathe themselves in their own sight for the evils which they have committed in all their abominations.
Translated_sentences: And they will mention unto me, who of you will be preserved between the peoples, in the fretting, that they deplore their heart, which has passed away, and over the eyes of them, which have wrothed, following the foul snowmen of their own: and they will deter themselves for the spite they have done in all abominations of their own.

Sentences_from: A tak wzięli cielca, którego im dał, a zgotowawszy wzywali imienia Baalowego od poranku aż do południa, mówiąc: O Baalu, wysłuchaj nas! Ale nie było głosu, ani ktoby odpowiedział. I skakali koło ołtarza, który byli uczynili.
Sentences_to: They took the bull which was given them, and they dressed it, and called on the name of Baal from morning even until noon, saying, Baal, hear us. But there was no voice, nor any who answered. They leaped about the altar which was made.
Translated_sentences: And so they took the bullock he gave them, and they called the name of Baal from the morning until noon, saying, O Baal, hear us out! But there was no voice, no one answered. And they were jumping near the altar, which they had made.

Sentences_from: Kto wie, jeźli się nie obróci Bóg, a nie użali się tego, nie odwrócili się, mówię, od popędliwości gniewu swego, abyśmy nie zginęli.
Sentences_to: But I will sacrifice to you with the voice of thanksgiving. I will pay that which I have vowed. Salvation belongs to Yahweh."
Translated_sentences: Who knows, they will not turn God, and they will not feel sorry for it, they will not turn away, I say, from the propulsion of their wrath, lest we die.

Sentences_from: A ten miał trzydzieści synów, którzy jeździli na trzydziestu ośląt, a mieli trzydzieści miast, które zwano Awot Jair aż po dzisiejszy dzień w ziemi Galaadskiej.
Sentences_to: He had thirty sons who rode on thirty donkey colts, and they had thirty cities, which are called Havvoth Jair to this day, which are in the land of Gilead.
Translated_sentences: And this one had thirty sons who rode thirty blinds, and they had thirty cities, which were called Awot Jair until today in the land of Galaadian.

Sentences_from: W oneż dni widziałem w Judzie tłoczących prasy w sabat, i noszących snopy, które kładli na osły, także i winne grona, i figi, i wszelki ciężar, a przynoszących do Jeruzalemu w dzień sabatu, i zgromiłem ich onegoż dnia, którego sprzedawali żywność.
Sentences_to: In those days saw I in Judah some men treading winepresses on the Sabbath, and bringing in sheaves, and loading donkeys; as also wine, grapes, and figs, and all kinds of burdens, which they brought into Jerusalem on the Sabbath day: and I testified against them in the day in which they sold food.
Translated_sentences: On the days I saw in Judah pressing presses on the coven, and wearing sheaves, which they put on donkeys, also a guilty bunch, and figs, and all weight, and bringing to Jerusalem on the day of the Sabbath, and throttling them to the day they sold food.

Sentences_from: Ja zaiste jestem Pan, Bóg twój, który rozdzielam morze, tak, że szumią wały jego; Pan zastępów jest imię moje.
Sentences_to: For I am Yahweh your God, who stirs up the sea, so that its waves roar: Yahweh of Armies is his name.
Translated_sentences: I am, indeed, the LORD thy God, who separate the sea, so that they scum the shafts of his; the Lord of the deputies is my name.

Sentences_from: Wyrwij mię od tych, którzy broją nieprawość, a od mężów krwawych wybaw mię.
Sentences_to: For, behold, they lie in wait for my soul. The mighty gather themselves together against me, not for my disobedience, nor for my sin, Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: Scratch me from those who broach iniquity, and deliver me from my husbands.

Sentences_from: A synowie Izraelscy rozrodzili się, i rozpłodzili się, i rozmnożyli się, i zmocnili się bardzo wielce, a napełniona jest ziemia nimi.
Sentences_to: The children of Israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and grew exceedingly mighty; and the land was filled with them.
Translated_sentences: And the sons of Israel have been born, and they have dispensed, and they have multiplied, and they have strengthened very much, and the earth is filled with them.

Sentences_from: Tedy rozkazał Pan Bóg człowiekowi, mówiąc: Z każdego drzewa sadu jeść będziesz.
Sentences_to: Yahweh God commanded the man, saying, "Of every tree of the garden you may freely eat;
Translated_sentences: Tedy commanded the Lord God to man, saying: From every tree of the orchard, you shall eat.

Sentences_from: A gdyby się prorok dał zwieść, aby mówił słowo, Ja Pan zwiodłem proroka onego, i wyciągnę nań rękę swoję, i wygładzę go z pośrodku ludu mego Izraelskiego.
Sentences_to: If the prophet is deceived and speak a word, I, Yahweh, have deceived that prophet, and I will stretch out my hand on him, and will destroy him from the midst of my people Israel.
Translated_sentences: And if the prophet had been fooled into saying the word, I the LORD had failed the prophet, and I would extend my hand, and smooth it out of the middle of my people of Israel.

Sentences_from: Zna wół gospodarza swego, i osieł żłób pana swego; ale Izrael mię nie zna, lud mój nie zrozumiewa.
Sentences_to: The ox knows his owner, and the donkey his master's crib; but Israel doesn't know, my people don't consider."
Translated_sentences: He knows the ox of his host, and has placed his master's manger; but Israel does not know me, my people do not understand.

Sentences_from: Rozdzielił tedy one trzy sta mężów na trzy hufce, a dał trąby w ręce każdemu z nich, i dzbany czcze, i pochodnie w pośrodek dzbanów
Sentences_to: He divided the three hundred men into three companies, and he put into the hands of all of them trumpets, and empty pitchers, with torches within the pitchers.
Translated_sentences: Then they separated three men into three huffes, and gave trumpets into each of them, and pitchers worship, and torches in the middle of pitchers

Sentences_from: Tać będzie powinność domów synów Gersonowych w namiocie zgromadzenia, a będzie ich doglądał Itamar, syn Aarona kapłana.
Sentences_to: This is the service of the families of the sons of the Gershonites in the Tent of Meeting: and their duty shall be under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
Translated_sentences: This will be the homes of the Gerson sons in the tent of the congregation, and they will be looked after by Itamar, son of Aaron the priest.

Sentences_from: Teraz stworzone są, a nie onego czasu, o którycheś przed tym dniem nic nie słyszał, byś snać nie rzekł: Otom wiedział o tem.
Sentences_to: They are created now, and not from of old; and before this day you didn't hear them; lest you should say, 'Behold, I knew them.'
Translated_sentences: Now they are created, not of that time, about which you heard nothing before that day, lest you say: Otom knew about it.

Sentences_from: Przetoż wziął Johanan, syn Kareaszowy, i wszyscy książęta wojsk, którzy z nim byli, wszystek ostatek ludu, który zaś przywiódł od Izmaela, syna Natanijaszowego, z Masfy, gdy zabił Godolijasza, syna Ahikamowego, mężów walecznych, i niewiasty, i dziatki, i komorników, których zaś przywiódł z Gabaonu.
Sentences_to: Then took Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, all the remnant of the people whom he had recovered from Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, from Mizpah, after that he had killed Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the men of war, and the women, and the children, and the eunuchs, whom he had brought back from Gibeon:
Translated_sentences: Hence he took Johanan, son of Qareasah, and all the princes of the troops who were with him, all the last of the people who had brought from Ishmael, son of Nataniyah, from Masfa, when he killed Godoliyah, son of Ahikam, brave husbands, and little children, and bailiffs whom he had brought from Gaboise aonu.

Sentences_from: Króle też Madyjańskie pobili między inszymi pobitymi ich, Ewiego, i Rechema, i Sura, i Hura, i Rebaha, pięciu królów Madyjańskich, i Balaama, syna Beorowego, zabili mieczem.
Sentences_to: But if her husband forbids her in the day that he hears it, then he shall make void her vow which is on her, and the rash utterance of her lips, with which she has bound her soul: and Yahweh will forgive her.
Translated_sentences: The Madyan kings, too, had beaten between the others beaten them, Eve, and Rechem, and Sura, and Hura, and Rebah, five Madyan kings, and Balaam, son of Beor, killed with a sword.

Sentences_from: Albowiem czyhali na twoje złe; zmyślali radę, której dowieść nie mogli.
Sentences_to: For you will make them turn their back, when you aim drawn bows at their face.
Translated_sentences: For they lurched to thy evil; they made up advice that they could not prove.

Sentences_from: A teć są imiona synów Giersonowych, Lobni i Semei.
Sentences_to: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.
Translated_sentences: And that's the names of Gierson's sons, Lobni and Semea.

Sentences_from: I rzekła ona druga niewiasta: Nie tak; ale syn mój jest ten żywy, a syn twój ten umarły. Ale ona rzekła: Nie; ale syn twój jest ten umarły, a syn mój ten żywy. I tak się spierały przed królem.
Sentences_to: The other woman said, "No; but the living is my son, and the dead is your son." This said, "No; but the dead is your son, and the living is my son." Thus they spoke before the king.
Translated_sentences: And the other woman said, not so; but my son is the alive, and thy son died. But she said, No, but thy son is this dead, and my son is alive. And so they feuded in front of the king.

Sentences_from: Który to lud podał niezbożnym grób jego, a bogatemu śmierć jego, choć jednak nieprawości nie uczynił, ani zdrada znaleziona jest w ustach jego.
Sentences_to: They made his grave with the wicked, and with a rich man in his death; although he had done no violence, neither was any deceit in his mouth.
Translated_sentences: Whose people gave the unholy grave of him, and to the rich the death of him, though he did not do the iniquity, nor is betrayal found in his mouth.

Sentences_from: Ziemia wasza spustoszona, miasta wasze popalone ogniem. Ziemię waszę cudzoziemcy przed wami pożerają i pustoszą, jako zwykli cudzoziemcy.
Sentences_to: Your country is desolate. Your cities are burned with fire. Strangers devour your land in your presence, and it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers.
Translated_sentences: Your land ravaged, your cities burned with fire. The land your aliens before you devour and desert as ordinary aliens.

Sentences_from: Przetoż i dobytek nasz pójdzie z nami, a nie zostanie i kopyto; albowiem z tego weźmiemy do służby Panu, Bogu naszemu; bo my nie wiemy, czem służyć mamy Panu, aż tam przyjdziemy.
Sentences_to: Our livestock also shall go with us. Not a hoof shall be left behind, for of it we must take to serve Yahweh our God; and we don't know with what we must serve Yahweh, until we come there."
Translated_sentences: Hence, our possessions will come with us, and will not remain and hoof; for from this we will take our service to the Lord, our God; for we do not know what we have to serve the Lord until we come there.

Sentences_from: Wyleje jako deszcz na niepobożnych sidła, ogieó i siarkę, a wicher będzie cząstką kielicha ich.
Sentences_to: On the wicked he will rain blazing coals; fire, sulfur, and scorching wind shall be the portion of their cup.
Translated_sentences: It will pour out as rain on the unpious snare, stud and sulfur, and the whirlwind will be a particle of the chalice of theirs.

Sentences_from: Kain, Gabaa, i Tamna, miast dziesięć, i wsi ich.
Sentences_to: Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah; ten cities with their villages.
Translated_sentences: Cain, Gabaa, and Tamna, ten cities, and village them.

Sentences_from: Albowiem Ja znam sprawy ich, i myśli ich; i przyjdzie ten czas, że zgromadzę wszystkie narody, i języki, i przyjdą a oglądają chwałę moję.
Sentences_to: "For I know their works and their thoughts: the time comes, that I will gather all nations and languages; and they shall come, and shall see my glory.
Translated_sentences: For I know the affairs of them, and they think them; and there will come this time that I will gather all nations, and tongues, and they shall come, and they shall watch my glory.

Sentences_from: A wziąwszy Józef obydwu, postawił Efraima po prawej ręce swojej, a po lewej Izraelowej; a Manasesa po lewej ręce swojej a po prawej Izraelowej, i przywiódł je do niego.
Sentences_to: Joseph took them both, Ephraim in his right hand toward Israel's left hand, and Manasseh in his left hand toward Israel's right hand, and brought them near to him.
Translated_sentences: And having taken Joseph both, he put Ephraim on his right hand and Israel's left hand; and Manases on his left hand and on Israel's right, and he brought them to him.

Sentences_from: A tak bieżał jezdny przeciwko niemu, i rzekł: Tak mówi król: A pokój? I odpowiedział Jehu: Co tobie do pokoju? Obróć się, jedź za mną. Przetoż oznajmił stróż mówiąc: Dojechałci poseł do nich, ale się nie wraca.
Sentences_to: So there went one on horseback to meet him, and said, "Thus says the king, 'Is it peace?'" Jehu said, "What do you have to do with peace? Fall in behind me!" The watchman said, "The messenger came to them, but he isn't coming back."
Translated_sentences: And so ran the roadway against him, and said, So says the king, And peace? And Jehu replied: What's the peace to you? Turn around, follow me. Therefore, he declared the watchman saying: The MP has been commuted to them, but he does not return.

Sentences_from: A tak i Ja odkryję podołek twój aż na twarz twoję, aby się okazała sromota twoja.
Sentences_to: Therefore will I also uncover your skirts on your face, and your shame shall appear.
Translated_sentences: And so I will discover your stool all the way to your face, so that it turns out your vulva.

Sentences_from: A oto, słudzy Dawidowi i Joab wracali się z wojny, korzyści wielkie z sobą prowadząc, ale Abnera już nie było u Dawida w Hebronie: bo go był odprawił, i odszedł był w pokoju.
Sentences_to: Behold, the servants of David and Joab came from a foray, and brought in a great spoil with them: but Abner was not with David in Hebron; for he had sent him away, and he was gone in peace.
Translated_sentences: And behold, the servants of David and Joab were returning from the war, benefiting great with each other, but Abner was no longer at David's in Hebron: for he had done him, and he left was in peace.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Saul do Achijasa: Przystaw skrzynię Bożą; (bo była skrzynia Boża dnia onego z syny Izraelskimi.)
Sentences_to: Saul said to Ahijah, "Bring the ark of God here." For the ark of God was with the children of Israel at that time.
Translated_sentences: And Saul said unto Achijas, Pay God's chest; (for there was a chest of God's day from the son of Israel.)

Sentences_from: A synom Izraelskim tak powiesz, mówiąc: Olejek pomazywania świętego mnie będzie świętym w narodziech waszych;
Sentences_to: You shall speak to the children of Israel, saying, 'This shall be a holy anointing oil to me throughout your generations.
Translated_sentences: And to the sons of Israel will say so, saying: The oil of the holy me shall be sacred in your nation;

Sentences_from: Gdy siądziesz, abyś jadł z panem, uważaj pilnie, kto jest przed tobą;
Sentences_to: When you sit to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before you;
Translated_sentences: When you sit down, that you eat with you, be careful urgently who is in front of you;

Sentences_from: A gdy się wrócili do niego, (a on mieszkał w Jerycho,)rzekł do nich: Azażem wam nie mówił: Nie chodźcie?
Sentences_to: They came back to him, while he stayed at Jericho; and he said to them, "Didn't I tell you, 'Don't go?'"
Translated_sentences: And when they came back to him, (and he lived in Jericho,) he said unto them, Azarca did not say to you, Do not come?

Sentences_from: Tedy Jonasz począł chodzić po mieście, ile mógł za jeden dzień ujść, i wołał mówiąc: Po czterdziestu dniach Niniwe będzie wywrócone.
Sentences_to: I said, 'I have been banished from your sight; yet I will look again toward your holy temple.'
Translated_sentences: Tedy Jonah began to walk around the city as he could in a day to get away, and called out saying: After forty days, Nineveh would be capsized.

Sentences_from: I pobił ich król Babiloński, a pomordował ich w Ryblacie w ziemi Emat. A tak przeniesiony jest Juda z ziemi swojej.
Sentences_to: The king of Babylon struck them, and put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away captive out of his land.
Translated_sentences: And they were beaten by the king of Babylonian, and murdered them in Ryblat in the land of Emat. And so Judah is moved from his land.

Sentences_from: Znowu zaczął przypowieść swoję, i rzekł: Ach! któż będzie żyw, gdy to uczyni Bóg?
Sentences_to: He took up his parable, and said, "Alas, who shall live when God does this?
Translated_sentences: He began his parable again, and said, Ah! Who will be alive when God does this?

Sentences_from: A tak odprowadzili zasię Sadok i Abijatar skrzynię Bożą do Jeruzalemu, i zostali tam.
Sentences_to: Zadok therefore and Abiathar carried the ark of God again to Jerusalem; and they stayed there.
Translated_sentences: And so they escorted Sadok and Abijatar God's chest to Jerusalem, and they stayed there.

Sentences_from: Oczyść mię, isopem, a oczyszczon będę; omyj mię, a nad śnieg wybielony będę.
Sentences_to: Hide your face from my sins, and blot out all of my iniquities.
Translated_sentences: Clear me, isop, and I will be cleared; bypassing me, and over the snow I will be bleached.

Sentences_from: Cóż się przechwalasz dolinami? Spłynęła dolina twoja, o córko uporna! która ufasz w skarbach twoich, mówiąc: Któż przyciągnie przeciwko mnie?
Sentences_to: Why do you glory in the valleys, your flowing valley, backsliding daughter? who trusted in her treasures, saying, Who shall come to me?
Translated_sentences: What do you brag about valleys? Your valley has flowed, O daughter persistent! who trust in your treasures, saying, Who will draw against me?

Sentences_from: Potłukł gradem szczepy ich, a drzewa leśnych fig ich gradem lodowym.
Sentences_to: He destroyed their vines with hail, their sycamore fig trees with frost.
Translated_sentences: He broke the hail strains of them, and the trees of forest figs with their ice hail.

Sentences_from: A rzecze do nich: Słuchaj Izraelu, wy dziś staczacie bitwę z nieprzyjacioły waszymi; niechajże nie słabieje serce wasze, nie bójcie się i nie trwożcie sobą, ani się ich lękajcie;
Sentences_to: You shall prepare you the way, and divide the borders of your land, which Yahweh your God causes you to inherit, into three parts, that every manslayer may flee there.
Translated_sentences: And things unto them: Listen to Israel, you are fighting a battle with your enemies today; you are not fainting your heart, do not fear, and do not fear yourself, nor fear them;

Sentences_from: Będzie błogosławił tym, którzy się boją Pana, małym i wielkim.
Sentences_to: He will bless those who fear Yahweh, both small and great.
Translated_sentences: He will bless those who fear the Lord, small and great.

Sentences_from: A tak zabijcie baranka wielkanocnego, a poświęćcie się, i przygotujcie braci waszych, sprawując się według słowa Pańskiego, podanego przez Mojżesza.
Sentences_to: He did this in the cities of Manasseh and Ephraim and Simeon, even to Naphtali, around in their ruins.
Translated_sentences: And so kill the Easter lamb, and sacrifice yourselves, and prepare your brothers, exercising themselves according to the word of the Lord given by Moses.

Sentences_from: I stało się, gdy był czas sprawowania ofiary śniednej, przystąpił Elijasz prorok, i rzekł: Panie, Boże Abrahama, Izaaka, i Izraela! dziś niech poznają, żeś ty jest Bogiem w Izraelu, a jam sługa twój, a żem według słowa twego uczynił to wszystko.
Sentences_to: It happened at the time of the offering of the offering, that Elijah the prophet came near, and said, "Yahweh, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, let it be known this day that you are God in Israel, and that I am your servant, and that I have done all these things at your word.
Translated_sentences: And it happened, when there was a time of making the sacrifice of the snow, Elyjah the prophet proceeded, and said, Lord, God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel. today let them know that you are God in Israel, and I am thy servant, and that by thy word he has done it all.

Sentences_from: Kapłanów jego przyoblokę zbawieniem, a święci jego weseląc się, radować się będą.
Sentences_to: Her priests I will also clothe with salvation. Her saints will shout aloud for joy.
Translated_sentences: The priests are his salvation, and the saints of his mercy, will rejoice.

Sentences_from: Także wszyscy starsi miasta onego, które jest najbliższe zabitego, umyją ręce swoje nad jałowicą ściętą w dolinie;
Sentences_to: What man is there who has planted a vineyard, and has not used its fruit? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man use its fruit.
Translated_sentences: Also all the elders of the town that is closest to the slain will wash their hands over juniper beheaded in the valley;

Sentences_from: I dał mu znak dnia onegoż, mówiąc: Tenci jest znak, że to mówił Pan: Oto się ołtarz rozpadnie, a wysypie się popiół, który jest na nim.
Sentences_to: He gave a sign the same day, saying, "This is the sign which Yahweh has spoken: Behold, the altar will be split apart, and the ashes that are on it will be poured out."
Translated_sentences: And he gave him a sign of the day, saying: Tenci is a sign that the LORD said, Behold, the altar will fall apart, and the ash that is on it will come out.

Sentences_from: Z ręki grobu wybawię ich, od śmierci wykupię ich. O śmierci! będę śmiercią twoją; o grobie! będę skażeniem twojem; żałość skryta będzie od oczów moich.
Sentences_to: Ephraim has bitterly provoked anger. Therefore his blood will be left on him, and his Lord will repay his contempt.
Translated_sentences: From the hand of the grave I will deliver them, from death I will redeem them. About death! I shall be thy death; O grave! I will be contaminated with yours; the regrets will be from my eyes.

Sentences_from: Na szyi swej prześladowanie cierpiemy, pracujemy, a nie dadzą nam odpocząć.
Sentences_to: Our pursuers are on our necks: We are weary, and have no rest.
Translated_sentences: At the neck of our persecution, we suffer, we work, and we will not give us a rest.

Sentences_from: Także i Lewitowie, którzy się oddalali odemnie, gdy błądził Izrael, którzy się obłądzili odemnie za plugawemi bałwanami swemi, ci poniosą nieprawość swoję.
Sentences_to: But the Levites who went far from me, when Israel went astray, who went astray from me after their idols, they shall bear their iniquity.
Translated_sentences: Also the Levites, who distanced themselves when Israel erred, who were insane for foul swemi snowmen, will suffer their iniquity.

Sentences_from: Mówi w sercu swem: Nie będę wzruszony od narodu do narodu; bo się nie boję złego.
Sentences_to: He says in his heart, "I shall not be shaken. For generations I shall have no trouble."
Translated_sentences: He says in his heart: I will not be touched from nation to nation; for I am not afraid of evil.

Sentences_from: I stało się, gdy powstał Filistyóczyk, i szedł, a przybliżał się przeciwko Dawidowi, że pospieszył i Dawid, a bieżał na spotkanie przeciwko Filistynowi:
Sentences_to: It happened, when the Philistine arose, and came and drew near to meet David, that David hurried, and ran toward the army to meet the Philistine.
Translated_sentences: And it happened when the Philistine arose, and he walked, and he came against David, that he hurried and David, and ran for the meeting against the Philistine:

Sentences_from: I mówił z nimi król; ale nie był znaleziony między onymi wszystkimi, jako Danijel, Ananijasz, Misael i Azaryjasz; i stawali przed obliczem królewskiem.
Sentences_to: The king talked with them; and among them all was found none like Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah: therefore stood they before the king.
Translated_sentences: And the king spoke with them; but he was not found between all of them, as Danijel, Ananiyah, Misael and Azaryah; and they faced the royal face.

Sentences_from: Weźmiecie też snopek hysopu, i omoczycie we krwi, która będzie w miednicy, a pokropicie odrzwi, i oba podwoje oną krwią, która będzie w miednicy; a z was nie wynijdzie żaden ze drzwi domu swego aż do poranku.
Sentences_to: You shall take a bunch of hyssop, and dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and strike the lintel and the two doorposts with the blood that is in the basin; and none of you shall go out of the door of his house until the morning.
Translated_sentences: You will also take a sheaf of hysop, and soak in the blood that will be in the pelvis, and the drip will open, and both double the blood that will be in the pelvis; and none of you will come from the door of your house until the morning.

Sentences_from: Ołtarz do całopalenia, i kratę jego miedzianą, drążki jego, i wszystkie naczynia jego, wannę z stolcem jej.
Sentences_to: the altar of burnt offering, with its grating of brass, it poles, and all its vessels, the basin and its base;
Translated_sentences: The altar for burns, and the plaid of his copper, sticks his, and all his dishes, a bath of stool hers.

Sentences_from: Do ziemi, w której bez niedostatku jeść będziesz chleb, a na żadnej rzeczy schodzić ci nie będzie; do ziemi, której kamienie są żelazo, a z jej gór miedź kopać będziesz.
Sentences_to: a land in which you shall eat bread without scarceness, you shall not lack anything in it; a land whose stones are iron, and out of whose hills you may dig copper.
Translated_sentences: To the land in which without scarcity you will eat bread, and on no thing you will descend; to the earth whose stones are iron, and from its mountains copper you will dig.

Sentences_from: Edomczyków, i Moabczyków, i synów Ammonowych;
Sentences_to: Edom, and Moab, and the children of Ammon;
Translated_sentences: Edomians, and Moabians, and sons of Ammon;

Sentences_from: Oprócz tego, co przychodziło od kupców i z handlu tych, którzy rzeczami wonnemi kupczyli, i od wszystkich królów Arabskich, i książąt ziemi.
Sentences_to: besides that which the traders brought, and the traffic of the merchants, and of all the kings of the mixed people, and of the governors of the country.
Translated_sentences: In addition to what came from merchants and from trade those who had wonnemi goods bought, and from all Arab kings, and princes of the land.

Sentences_from: I czynił dobrze Bóg onym babom; i krzewił się lud, i zmocnili się bardzo.
Sentences_to: God dealt well with the midwives, and the people multiplied, and grew very mighty.
Translated_sentences: And God did well to the babom; and the people shrug, and they strengthened very much.

Sentences_from: A tak odstąpili wszyscy mężowie Izraelscy od Dawida za Sebą, synem Bichry; ale mężowie Judzcy trzymali się króla swego, od Jordanu aż do Jeruzalemu.
Sentences_to: So all the men of Israel went up from following David, and followed Sheba the son of Bichri; but the men of Judah joined with their king, from the Jordan even to Jerusalem.
Translated_sentences: And so all the husbands of Israel departed from David for Seba, the son of Bichra; but the husbands of Judah held on to their king, from Jordan to Jerusalem.

Sentences_from: A tak było po cztery koła pod onem listwowaniem, a osi kół wychodziły z podstawka, a każde koło było wzwyż na półtora łokcia.
Sentences_to: The four wheels were underneath the panels; and the axles of the wheels were in the base: and the height of a wheel was a cubit and half a cubit.
Translated_sentences: And so it was four wheels under it, and the axles of the wheels came out of the stand, and each wheel was high at one and a half elbows.

Sentences_from: A ci, którzy weszli do domu Michasowego, wzięli obraz ryty, Efod i Terafim, i obraz lany; i rzekł do nich kapłan: Cóż to czynicie?
Sentences_to: When these went into Micah's house, and fetched the engraved image, the ephod, and the teraphim, and the molten image, the priest said to them, "What are you doing?"
Translated_sentences: And those who entered the house of Michasova took the image of the Rite, Efod and Terafim, and the image of the lana; and the priest said unto them, What do you do?

Sentences_from: Bo go złożył król Egipski w Jeruzalemie, i nałożył winę na onę ziemię sto talentów srebra, i talent złota.
Sentences_to: The king of Egypt deposed him at Jerusalem, and fined the land one hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold.
Translated_sentences: For he was laid by the King of Egypt in Jerusalem, and placed the blame on the land of a hundred talents of silver, and the talent of gold.

Sentences_from: Wysławiajcież Pana, albowiem jest dobry: albowiem na wieki miłosierdzie jego.
Sentences_to: Oh give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good, for his loving kindness endures forever.
Translated_sentences: Famed the Lord, for he is good: for ever his mercy.

Sentences_from: I rzekł do nich: Pójdźcie za mną: albowiem podał Pan nieprzyjacioły wasze Moabity w ręce wasze. Tedy szli za nim, a odjąwszy bród Jordański Moabitom, nie dopuszczali nikomu przeprawy.
Sentences_to: He said to them, "Follow me; for Yahweh has delivered your enemies the Moabites into your hand." They followed him, and took the fords of the Jordan against the Moabites, and didn't allow any man to pass over.
Translated_sentences: And he said unto them, Follow me, for the LORD unfriends your Moabites into your hands. The Tedy followed him, and having taken the Jordanian Moabites off the ford, they did not allow anyone to cross.

Sentences_from: A Isfan, i Eber, i Eliel,
Sentences_to: and Ishpan, and Eber, and Eliel,
Translated_sentences: And Isfan, and Eber, and Eliel,

Sentences_from: A w czwartym rzędzie: chryzolit, onychin i berył; te będą wsadzone w złoto w rzędziech swoich.
Sentences_to: and the fourth row a chrysolite, an onyx, and a jasper: they shall be enclosed in gold in their settings.
Translated_sentences: And in the fourth row: chrysolite, onychin and beryllium; these will be put in gold in the row of their own.

Sentences_from: Mów do synów Izraelskich, i rzecz im: Gdy przejdziecie przez Jordan do ziemi Chananejskiej.
Sentences_to: "'You shall mark out your east border from Hazar Enan to Shepham;
Translated_sentences: Speak to the sons of Israel, and the thing to them: When you pass through Jordan to the Khanite land.

Sentences_from: I zawiódł go na pole Sofim, na wierzch góry Fazga, i zbudował siedem ołtarzów, i ofiarował cielca i barana na każdym ołtarzu.
Sentences_to: He took him into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered up a bull and a ram on every altar.
Translated_sentences: And he let him down to the field of Sofim, on top of Mount Fazga, and built seven altars, and offered the bullock and ram on each altar.

Sentences_from: A do Dana rzekł: Dan jako szczenię lwie wyskakujące z Basan.
Sentences_to: Of Dan he said, "Dan is a lion's cub that leaps out of Bashan."
Translated_sentences: And to Dan said, Dan as a lion puppy popping out of Basan.

Sentences_from: Znowu rzekł do mnie: Jeszcze obróciwszy się ujrzysz obrzydliwości większe, które oni czynią.
Sentences_to: He said also to me, You shall again see yet other great abominations which they do.
Translated_sentences: Again, he said unto me, yet you will see the abominations greater that they do.

Sentences_from: A gdy wstępował płomieó z ołtarza ku niebu, tedy wstąpił Anioł Pański w płomieniu ołtarzowym, a Manue, i żona jego widząc to, upadli na twarze swe na ziemię.
Sentences_to: For it happened, when the flame went up toward the sky from off the altar, that the angel of Yahweh ascended in the flame of the altar: and Manoah and his wife looked on; and they fell on their faces to the ground.
Translated_sentences: And when he rose flame from the altar towards heaven, then the Angel of the Lord joined in the altar flame, and Manue, and his wife, seeing it, fell on their faces to the ground.

Sentences_from: I rzekł do chłopca swego: Bież, szukaj prędko strzał, które ja wystrzelę. Tedy chłopiec bieżał; a on wystrzelił strzały dalej przedeó.
Sentences_to: He said to his boy, "Run, find now the arrows which I shoot." As the boy ran, he shot an arrow beyond him.
Translated_sentences: And he said unto his boy, Run, look for the arrows that I will fire. Tedy boy treaded; and he fired shots further ahead.

Sentences_from: Daj mi żony moje, i dzieci moje, za którem ci służył, że odejdę; bo ty wiesz posługi moje, jakom ci służył.
Sentences_to: Give me my wives and my children for whom I have served you, and let me go; for you know my service with which I have served you."
Translated_sentences: Give me my wives, and my children, for whom he served you, that I will leave; for you know my ministry as he served you.

Sentences_from: Tedy poseł, który chodził, aby przyzwał Micheasza, rzekł do niego, mówiąc: Oto teraz słowa proroków jednemi usty dobrze tuszą królowi; niechże będzie proszę słowo twoje, jako słowo jednego z nich, a mów dobre rzeczy.
Sentences_to: The messenger who went to call Micaiah spoke to him, saying, "See now, the prophets declare good to the king with one mouth. Please let your word be like the word of one of them, and speak good."
Translated_sentences: The Tedy MP, who went to summone Mikheah, said unto him, saying: Here are now the words of the prophets with one mouth well carcass the king; let me be thy word, as the word of one of them, and say good things.

Sentences_from: Synów Pashurowych tysiąc dwieście czterdzieści i siedm;
Sentences_to: The children of Pashhur, one thousand two hundred forty-seven.
Translated_sentences: Sons of Pashur one thousand two hundred and forty and seven;

Sentences_from: Do tego wygotowali kamienie onychiny, oprawione złotem osadzeniem, rzezane, jako ryte bywają pieczęci, z imiony synów Izraelskich.
Sentences_to: They worked the onyx stones, enclosed in settings of gold, engraved with the engravings of a signet, according to the names of the children of Israel.
Translated_sentences: For this, they cooked stones of onychin, framed with gold embedding, as seals are engraved, from the names of the sons of Israel.

Sentences_from: A synowie Chamowi: Chus, i Micraim, i Put, i Chanaan.
Sentences_to: The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
Translated_sentences: And Cham's sons: Chus, and Micraim, and Put, and Khanaan.

Sentences_from: Dnia onego pomdleją panienki piękne, nawet i młodzieńcy od onego pragnienia;
Sentences_to: In that day the beautiful virgins and the young men will faint for thirst.
Translated_sentences: On this day, beautiful ladies will flinch, even young people from his desire;

Sentences_from: Albo jeźliby mając kamień w ręku, którym by mógł zabić, uderzył go, tak żeby umarł, mężobójcą jest; śmiercią umrze on mężobójca.
Sentences_to: "These are the names of the men who shall divide the land to you for inheritance: Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun.
Translated_sentences: Or they would ride with a stone in their hand to kill, hit him, so that he dies, the hubby is; death he will die.

Sentences_from: Będzieszli mądrym, sobie będziesz mądrym; a jeźli naśmiewcą, ty sam szkodę odniesiesz.
Sentences_to: If you are wise, you are wise for yourself. If you mock, you alone will bear it.
Translated_sentences: You will be wise, you will be wise, and you will be wise, and ridden the dustful, you will be the detriment.

Sentences_from: I Elisama, i Beelijada, i Elifelet.)
Sentences_to: and Elishama, and Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
Translated_sentences: And Elisama, and Beelijada, and Elifelet.)

Sentences_from: Nie będą Panu wina ofiarowali, ani mu będą przyjemne. Ofiary ich będą im jako chleb płaczących; którzybykolwiek z niego jedli, zmazaliby się, przeto, że chleb ich za umarłych ich nie wnijdzie do domu Pańskiego.
Sentences_to: They have set up kings, but not by me. They have made princes, and I didn't approve. Of their silver and their gold they have made themselves idols, that they may be cut off.
Translated_sentences: They will not offer your wine, nor will they be pleasant to him. Their sacrifices shall be to them as the bread of the crying; whomever they ate from it, they would smear, so that their bread for the dead shall not enter the house of the Lord.

Sentences_from: Mów, a rzecz: Tak mówi panujący Pan: Otom Ja przeciwko tobie o Faraonie, królu Egipski, wielorybie wielki, który leżysz w pośrodku rzek twoich, i mówisz: Mojać jest rzeka, i jam ją sobie uczynił;
Sentences_to: Speak and say, 'Thus says the Lord Yahweh: "Behold, I am against you, Pharaoh king of Egypt, the great monster that lies in the midst of his rivers, that has said, 'My river is my own, and I have made it for myself.'
Translated_sentences: Speak, and the thing: So says the reigning LORD, Otom Me against you about Pharaoh, King of Egypt, the great whale that you lie in the middle of thy rivers, and you say, My is a river, and I have made it to himself;

Sentences_from: Śpiewajcie mu, śpiewajcie mu psalmy, rozmawiajcie o wszystkich cudach jego.
Sentences_to: Sing to him, sing praises to him! Tell of all his marvelous works.
Translated_sentences: Sing to him, sing psalms to him, talk about all the miracles of his.

Sentences_from: I uczynił Mojżesz, jako rozkazał Pan; i wstąpili na górę Hor przed oczyma wszystkiego zgromadzenia.
Sentences_to: Moses did as Yahweh commanded: and they went up into Mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation.
Translated_sentences: And Moses did, as the Lord commanded; and they ascended Mount Hor before the eyes of all congregation.

Sentences_from: I ostrze miecza jego stępiłeś, a nie ratowałeś go w bitwie.
Sentences_to: You have ended his splendor, and thrown his throne down to the ground.
Translated_sentences: And the blade of his sword, you blunted him, and you did not save him in battle.

Sentences_from: Niech rozsądzi Pan między mną i między tobą, a niech się zemści Pan krzywdy mojej nad tobą; lecz ręka moja nie będzie na tobie.
Sentences_to: Then David and his men, who were about six hundred, arose and departed out of Keilah, and went wherever they could go. It was told Saul that David was escaped from Keilah; and he gave up going there.
Translated_sentences: May the LORD be judged between me and between you, and may the Lord revenge my wrongs over thee; but my hand will not be upon thee.

Sentences_from: I żył Matuzalem po spłodzeniu Lamecha siedem set osiemdziesiąt lat, i dwa lata, i spłodził syny i córki.
Sentences_to: Methuselah lived after he became the father of Lamech seven hundred eighty-two years, and became the father of sons and daughters.
Translated_sentences: And lived Matuzal after begat Lamech seven hundred and eighty years, and begat sons and daughters.

Sentences_from: Pójdźcież, a oglądajcie sprawy Boże; straszny jest w sprawach swoich przy synach ludzkich.
Sentences_to: Come, and see God's deeds-- awesome work on behalf of the children of men.
Translated_sentences: Go, and watch God's affairs; he is terrible in his own affairs in front of the sons of men.

Sentences_from: A teraz znieś proszę grzech mój, a wróć się ze mną, abym się pokłonił Panu.
Sentences_to: Now therefore, please pardon my sin, and turn again with me, that I may worship Yahweh."
Translated_sentences: Now bear my sin, and come back with me to bow to the Lord.

Sentences_from: I kruszyłem szczęki złośnika, a z zębów jego wydzierałem łup.
Sentences_to: I broke the jaws of the unrighteous, and plucked the prey out of his teeth.
Translated_sentences: And I crumbled the jaws of the malice, and from his teeth I yanked the loot.

Sentences_from: A ty wstawszy idź do domu twego a gdy wchodzić będziesz do miasta, tedy umrze dziecię.
Sentences_to: Arise therefore, and go to your house. When your feet enter into the city, the child shall die.
Translated_sentences: And you get up, go to thy house, and when you enter the city, then a person will die.

Sentences_from: I ofiarować będzie Aaron Lewity na ofiarę przed panem od synów Izraelskich, aby sprawowali posługi Pańskie.
Sentences_to: and Aaron shall offer the Levites before Yahweh for a wave offering, on the behalf of the children of Israel, that it may be theirs to do the service of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: And to offer Aaron the Levites for the sacrifice before the Lord from the sons of Israel, to exercise the ministry of the Lord.

Sentences_from: Prawda z ziemi wyrośnie, a sprawiedliwość z nieba wyjrzy.
Sentences_to: Yes, Yahweh will give that which is good. Our land will yield its increase.
Translated_sentences: The truth from the earth will grow, and justice from heaven will look out.

Sentences_from: Nauczcież mię, a ja umilknę; a w czemem zbłądził pokażcie mi.
Sentences_to: "Teach me, and I will hold my peace. Cause me to understand wherein I have erred.
Translated_sentences: Teach me, and I will make good; and in what he strays, show me.

Sentences_from: Z pokolenia Symeonowego Salamijel, syn Surysaddajów.
Sentences_to: Of Simeon: Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
Translated_sentences: From the generation of Simeon Salamijel, son of the Surysaddai.

Sentences_from: Z talentu złota szczerego uczynił go, i wszystko naczynie jego.
Sentences_to: He made it of a talent of pure gold, with all its vessels.
Translated_sentences: Of the talent of gold sincere made him, and all the vessel of his.

Sentences_from: Zatwardź serce ludu tego, a uszy jego obciąż, i oczy jego zawrzyj, aby nie widział oczyma swemi, a uszyma swemi nie słyszał, i sercem swem nie zrozumiał, a nie nawrócił się, i nie był uzdrowion.
Sentences_to: Make the heart of this people fat. Make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes; lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and turn again, and be healed."
Translated_sentences: Enhance the heart of the people, and the ears of his incriminations, and the eyes of his curve, so that he did not see the eyes of the swemi, and he did not hear, and at his heart he did not understand, and did not convert, and he was not healed.

Sentences_from: I nazwała imię jego Józef, mówiąc: Niech mi przyda Pan drugiego syna.
Sentences_to: She named him Joseph, saying, "May Yahweh add another son to me."
Translated_sentences: And she called his name Joseph, saying: May the Lord use me a second son.

Sentences_from: Synowie Racheli, żony Jakóbowej: Józef i Benjamin.
Sentences_to: The sons of Rachel, Jacob's wife: Joseph and Benjamin.
Translated_sentences: Sons of Rachela, Jakóbowa's wife: Joseph and Benjamin.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Ornan do Dawida: Weźmij je sobie, a niech uczyni król, pan mój, co mu się dobrego widzi; otoć przydaję i woły na całopalenia, i wóz na drwa, i pszenicę na ofiarę śniedną: toć to wszystko daję.
Sentences_to: Ornan said to David, "Take it for yourself, and let my lord the king do that which is good in his eyes. Behold, I give the oxen for burnt offerings, and the threshing instruments for wood, and the wheat for the meal offering. I give it all."
Translated_sentences: And Ornan said unto David, Take them, and let the king be done, my lord, which is good to see him; the surroundings are useful and oxen for burns, and wagons on lumberjacks, and wheat for the sacrifice fall: so I give it all.

Sentences_from: Kto czyni zamięszanie w domu swoim, odziedziczy wiatr, a głupi musi służyć mądremu.
Sentences_to: He who troubles his own house shall inherit the wind. The foolish shall be servant to the wise of heart.
Translated_sentences: Whoever makes a lock in the house his will inherit the wind, and the stupid must serve the wise.

Sentences_from: Ale iż Nadab i Abiju umarli przed obliczem ojca swego, a synów nie mieli: przetoż odprawowali urząd kapłański Eleazar i Itamar.
Sentences_to: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and had no children: therefore Eleazar and Ithamar executed the priest's office.
Translated_sentences: But that Nadab and Abiju died before the face of their father, and they had no sons: they held the priestly office of Eleazar and Itamar.

Sentences_from: Oto póki było całe, nic nie mogło być z niego urobione; dopieroż gdy je ogieó strawił, a spaliło się, na nic się więcej nie przyda.
Sentences_to: Behold, when it was whole, it was meet for no work: how much less, when the fire has devoured it, and it is burned, shall it yet be meet for any work!
Translated_sentences: Behold while it was whole, nothing could be made of it; when it digested it, and burned, it would be no use for anything else.

Sentences_from: Pamiętaj co uczynił Pan, Bóg twój, Maryi w drodze, gdyście wyszli z Egiptu.
Sentences_to: When you go forth in camp against your enemies, then you shall keep yourselves from every evil thing.
Translated_sentences: Remember what the LORD thy God did, Mary on the way, if you came out of Egypt.

Sentences_from: To gdy usłyszał Elijasz, zakrył oblicze swoje płaszczem swoim, a wyszedłszy stanął we drzwiach jaskini. A oto do niego głos mówiący: Co tu czynisz Elijaszu?
Sentences_to: It was so, when Elijah heard it, that he wrapped his face in his mantle, and went out, and stood in the entrance of the cave. Behold, a voice came to him, and said, "What are you doing here, Elijah?"
Translated_sentences: When he heard Elijah, he covered his face with his coat, and came out in the door of the cave. And here is to him a voice saying, What are you doing here, Elijah?

Sentences_from: Potem rzekli: Nużeż, zbudujmy sobie miasto i wieżą, której by wierzch dosięgał do nieba, a uczyńmy sobie imię; byśmy się snać nie rozproszyli po obliczu wszystkiej ziemi.
Sentences_to: They said, "Come, let's build ourselves a city, and a tower whose top reaches to the sky, and let's make ourselves a name, lest we be scattered abroad on the surface of the whole earth."
Translated_sentences: Then they said, “Nudeye, let us build ourselves a city and a tower whose top would reach heaven, and let us make a name for ourselves; we would not scatter upon the face of all earth.

Sentences_from: Oto ja według słów twoich odpowiem ci za Boga, chociażem ja też z błota utworzony.
Sentences_to: Behold, I am toward God even as you are. I am also formed out of the clay.
Translated_sentences: Behold I, in your words, will answer you for God, while I too from the mud formed.

Sentences_from: Pragnie dusza moja do Boga, do Boga żywego, mówiąc: Kiedyż przyjdę, a okażę się przed obliczem Bożem?
Sentences_to: My tears have been my food day and night, while they continually ask me, "Where is your God?"
Translated_sentences: I want my soul to Allah, to the living God, saying, Whenever I shall come, and shall I turn out before the face of God?

Sentences_from: Takby i ciebie wyrwał z miejsca ciasnego na przestronne, gdzie niemasz ucisku, a spokojny stół twój byłby pełen tłustości.
Sentences_to: Yes, he would have allured you out of distress, into a broad place, where there is no restriction. That which is set on your table would be full of fatness.
Translated_sentences: Takby and you snatched from a place tight to spacious, where you have no oppression, and a quiet table of yours would be full of greasiness.

Sentences_from: Były też komory i drzwi ich przy podwojach bram, a tam omywano całopalenia.
Sentences_to: A room with its door was by the posts at the gates; there they washed the burnt offering.
Translated_sentences: There were also chambers and doors of them at the double gates, and there were burns.

Sentences_from: Nad to rzekł Mojżesz: Ukaż mi proszę, chwałę twoję.
Sentences_to: He said, "Please show me your glory."
Translated_sentences: Moses said above this, show me please, glory thy.

Sentences_from: A w koszu najwyższym były wszelakie potrawy Faraonowe, roboty piekarskiej, a ptactwo jadło je z kosza, który był nad głową moją.
Sentences_to: In the uppermost basket there was all kinds of baked food for Pharaoh, and the birds ate them out of the basket on my head."
Translated_sentences: And in the basket of the highest were all Pharaonic dishes, bakery works, and fowl ate them from the basket that was above my head.

Sentences_from: A wnętrzności jego, i nogi jego, opłucze wodą, i zapali kapłan to wszystko na ołtarzu; całopalenie jest ofiary ognistej ku wdzięcznej wonności Panu.
